title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Electronic Printing and Customer Communications Veteran Laurence O’Hagan Joins StreamServe as Chief Technology Officer
The full text of the press release: Electronic Printing and Customer Communications Veteran Laurence O’Hagan Joins StreamServe as Chief Technology Officer /brJuly 20; 2010/brO’Hagan will leverage his past experience to drive the strategic vision and innovative planning behind StreamServe’s newest business communications solutions /brBURLINGTON; Mass.  (BUSINESS WIRE)  StreamServe; a leading provider of business communication solutions for document efficiency and customer experience management; announces the appointment of Laurence O’Hagan to the position of Chief Technology Officer. In this role; O’Hagan will be responsible for driving the strategic vision and planning behind StreamServe’s innovative solutions; product development and technical support. /br“Through his technical expertise; as well as his product and market vision; he will help us drive our product planning and developments to extend our technology into newer areas; such as cloud based offerings.”/brO’Hagan brings a tremendous amount of senior technical experience and visionary leadership to StreamServe; and is considered an industry expert in the field of document automation and related technologies. He was most recently Chief Technology Officer for the Customer Communications Management division of Pitney Bowes Business Insight (PBBI); a position he was appointed to in 2004; when Pitney Bowes acquired Group 1 Software. At PBBI; he conceived and architected DOC1; the company’s core flagship solution for Customer Communications Management; as well as other pivotal products; including EngageOne Interactive and Content Author. In 2009; he additionally assumed the Global Portfolio Directorship for Customer Communications Management; responsible for its vision and strategy. /brO’Hagan was Chief Technology Officer of Customer Communications Systems at Group 1 Software between 1994 through 2004. He also held the position of President and Technical Director at Archetype; Inc.; from 1986 to 1994. O’Hagan attended University College of London; where he was trained as a physicist. /br“We are absolutely thrilled with Laurence’s new role with StreamServe;” commented Dennis Ladd; StreamServe’s president and CEO. “Through his technical expertise; as well as his product and market vision; he will help us drive our product planning and developments to extend our technology into newer areas; such as cloud based offerings.” /br“StreamServe is well known for how it’s innovative and flexible customer communications management solutions integrate seamlessly with larger partner offerings; such as SAP and Adobe;” said O’Hagan. “I look forward to leveraging my past technical experience to advance StreamServe’s product offerings and to further propel the company’s leadership in the marketplace.” /brAbout StreamServe /brStreamServe is a leading provider of enterprise business communication solutions. Simple to deploy and maintain; the company’s dynamic composition; document process automation and enterprise output management solutions meet the demanding challenges of today’s global businesses for producing and delivering highly customized documents in any format. /brStreamServe’s advanced software solutions ease the process of composing and automating business communications; enabling organizations to increase the value and profitability of their business relationships. This is done all while leveraging existing business applications such as ERP; CRM and ECM. /brThe company was founded in 1997 and is headquartered in Burlington; Mass.; with 14 offices worldwide. StreamServe serves more than 5;000 customers in 130 countries; primarily in the financial services; utilities; manufacturing; distribution and telecom sectors. Customers include BMW; CLP Power Hong Kong; AmerisourceBergen; and Siemens Financial. StreamServe’s strategic partners include Adobe Systems; IBM; InfoPrint Solutions Company; Lawson and SAP AG. To learn how StreamServe’s business communications solutions can help drive efficiency and improve costs within your organization; please visit StreamServe online at http://www.streamserve.com; or join the conversation on StreamShare™; StreamServe’s online community forum: http://streamshare.streamserve.com/. /brStreamServe; StreamShare; and the StreamServe logo are all trademarks of StreamServe Inc. Some software products marketed by StreamServe Inc. and its distributors contain proprietary software components of other software vendors. All other product and service names mentioned are the trademarks of their respective companies. ©StreamServe Inc. 2010 /brPhotos/Multimedia Gallery Available: http://www.businesswire.com/cgi bin/mmg.cgi?eid=6366157&lang=en /brContacts /brStreamServe contacts:/brPeter J. Gorman; 781 761 6659 Mobile: 617 669 4329 /brSr. Director; Corporate Communications/brEmail: peter.gorman@streamserve.com/brTwitter: http://twitter.com/StreamServe/brFacebook: http://bit.ly/dkOpQG/brStreamShare: http://streamshare.streamserve.com/brWeb: http://www.streamserve.com
what happened: StreamServe appointed Laurence O’Hagan as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Laurence O'Hagan was previously the Chief Technology Officer; CCM Division at Pitney Bowes Business Insight.
about company: StreamServe is a global leader in dynamic document composition; management and delivery solutions for customer communications.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Alcoa board appointments
Industry: Manufacturing : Tools; Hardware and Light Machinery
The full text of the press release: Alcoa board appointments /br26 September 2008/brAustralian Company News Bites /brAUSTRALIAN COMPANY NEWS BITES/brSOURCED FROM INFORMATION LODGED WITH THE AUSTRALIAN STOCK EXCHANGE/brAlcoa Inc appointed Kurt Waldo as vice president and general counsel; Jake Siewert as vice president   business development and public strategy and William J O’Rourke as vice president – global business services and chief information officer on September 26; 2008./brMr Waldo will be responsible for Alcoa's global legal team; crafting legal strategies; enabling business transactions and managing internal and external legal resources.. He was deputy general counsel responsible for the antitrust; merger; acquisition and divestiture practice areas./brMr Siewert will be responsible for business and corporate development; including mergers; acquisitions; joint ventures and divestitures. He was vice president; global communications and public strategy responsible for overseeing and integrating the approach to the media; governments; local communities; and other stakeholders./brMr O’Rourke was president of Alcoa Russia; responsible for the manufacturing of assets acquired in Samara and Belaya Kalitva in the Russian Federation.
what happened: Alcoa appointed William O’Rourke as Chief Information Officer
about person: William O’Rourke was previously the President of Alcoa Russia; responsible for the substantial manufacturing assets Alcoa acquired in Samara and Belaya Kalitva in the Russian Federation.
about company: Alcoa is the world's leading producer of primary aluminum; fabricated aluminum; and alumina and is active in all major aspects of the aluminum industry.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Health Language Names Oswaldo H. León Chief Technology Officer ; León’s Extensive Experience in Strategic Planning; Operations and Software Development Will Help HLI Further Accelerate Growth and Market Leadership
The full text of the press release: Health Language Names Oswaldo H. León Chief Technology Officer ; León’s Extensive Experience in Strategic Planning; Operations and Software Development Will Help HLI Further Accelerate Growth and Market Leadership /br16 December 2008/brBusiness Wire/brEnglish/br/brDENVER   (BUSINESS WIRE)   Health Language; Inc.(®) (HLI); the world’s leading supplier of language engine technology for medical vocabulary mapping and interoperability; announced today that Oswaldo (Oz) H. León has joined the company as the Chief Technology Officer (CTO). León has more than 25 years of domestic and global experience in commercial software development; online information services and enterprise solutions; including extensive experience developing Internet based connectivity and clinical decision support solutions for the healthcare industry./br“We are extremely pleased that Oz is joining our team;" said George Schwend; HLI’s CEO and president. “HLI is rapidly transforming healthcare by facilitating interoperability of electronic medical records and data and records; and Oz’s deep knowledge of the healthcare industry and software architecture; security and integration will be invaluable assets. His skill set and experience in providing strategic; operational and technical direction will further accelerate our growth; product development and market leadership.”/br“HLI is a leader in providing services and software that enable the industry to enhance quality of care and patient safety;” León said. “I am looking forward to working with its strong management team and talented employees to help the industry achieve greater efficiencies by using our solutions to seamlessly exchange data.”/brPrior to joining HLI; León was CTO of Jones International Ltd.; where he was a member of the corporate executive management team that provided leadership for the technology direction and oversight of more than 20 business entities serving the e commerce; software; education and entertainment industries./brPreviously; he was senior vice president of product development and CTO of MPower Solutions Inc.; where he played a key role in leading a successful reorganization that resulted in the company going public and transitioning its product line to meet the changing technology and business needs. Before that; León was senior director of product development and technology at Micromedex Inc. He also served in senior leadership positions at Arco Coal Company; Echo Bay Mines; Great West Life Assurance Company; and Conoco./brLeón earned a Bachelor of Science degree in accounting and political science from Northwestern Oklahoma State University./brDownload Photo of Oswaldo H. León/brAbout Health Language Inc./brDenver based Health Language; Inc.(®) (HLI) develops and delivers state of the art software solutions that automatically incorporate medical vocabulary and coding standards into healthcare information technology (HCIT) applications. HLI’s Language Engine(®) (LE(®)) allows centralized access to medical terminology standards and generates mappings to create a common pool of standardized codes and concepts that enhance patient safety; facilitate clinical outcomes analysis and accelerate reimbursement. It also provides standards for modeling; storing; updating and distributing information consistently for interoperability between hospitals; regions and countries. For more information; visit www.healthlanguage.com [http://www.healthlanguage.com] or call 303.307.4400.
what happened: Health Language appointed Oswaldo Leon as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Oswaldo Leon was previously the CTO of Jones International Ltd.; where he was a member of the corporate executive management team that provided leadership for the technology direction and oversight of more than 20 business entities serving the e commerce; software; education and entertainment industries.
about company: Denver based Health Language; Inc.® (HLI) is the worldwide leader in developing and delivering state of the art software solutions that automatically incorporate medical vocabulary and coding standards into healthcare information technology (HCIT) applications.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Quantum Solar Power Corporation Names New CTO
The full text of the press release: SOURCE: Quantum Solar Power Corp./br /brMar 03; 2010 12:57 ET/brQuantum Solar Power Corporation Names New CTO/br/brSANTA FE; NM  (Marketwire   March 3; 2010)   Quantum Solar Power Corp (OTCBB: QSPW); a development stage company engaged in the advancement of Next Generation solar cell technology; announced today that it has named Dr. Andras G. Pattantyus Abraham as its new Chief Technology Officer. Dr. Pattantyus Abraham resigned his post at the University of Toronto to lead and to spearhead the growth of its photovoltaic science team; which is working on a groundbreaking photovoltaic technology./br/brDr. Pattantyus Abraham joined Quantum Solar in December 2009. Prior to coming to Quantum Solar; Dr. Pattantyus Abraham was Lead Scientist for novel photovoltaic devices in the Sargent Research Group; in the department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Toronto. From 2004 to 2006; Dr. Pattantyus Abraham was a Postdoctoral Fellow of the Photonic Nanostructures Research Group in the Physics department of the University of British Columbia./br/brDr. Pattantyus Abraham obtained degrees in Engineering Physics and Mathematics from Queen's University in Ontario. He then completed his doctoral thesis on semiconducting polymers at the University of British Columbia in the department of Chemistry./br/brAt the University of Toronto; Dr. Pattantyus Abraham made key contributions to the development of photovoltaic devices based on solution processed; infrared responsive quantum dots. His postdoctoral work at the University of British Columbia involved an important advance to the use of quantum dots in quantum information processing./br/br"We are looking forward to working with Dr. Pattantyus Abraham as he builds upon a legacy of success to establish a clear science direction for our revolutionary Next Generation photovoltaic devices;" states Daryl Ehrmantraut; President and CEO. Dr. Gary Leach; Quantum Science Lead adds "We are delighted to have Dr. Pattantyus Abraham on board. His in depth knowledge of photovoltaic technologies will be a huge asset to our efforts."/br/brAbout Quantum Solar Power Corp/br/brQuantum Solar Power Corp has developed a "Next Generation Device" (NGD) solar cell technology. Quantum's NGD is a patent pending; functioning laboratory model that demonstrates its utility in solar power conversion without the necessity of utilizing expensive silicon semiconductor based technologies. By relying on Quantum's NGD principle the conversion of light energy to electricity can be more than tripled over other low cost PV technologies. Accordingly; Quantum has the potential for manufacturing solar cells at significantly less cost per watt than current producers; without any limit to deployment on the terawatt scale. The Company's headquarters is located in Santa Fe; New Mexico and its web address is www.quantumsp.com./br/brContact:/brQuantum Solar Power Corp./brMedia Relations/br(505) 216 0725
what happened: Quantum Solar Power appointed Andras Pattantyus Abraham as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Andras Pattantyus Abraham was previously the Principal Scientist for Sargent Research Group; Electrical and Computer Engineering; University of Toronto.
about company: Quantum Solar Power Corp is a development stage company engaged in the advancement of Next Generation solar cell technology

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Linux Foundation names new CTO; Ted Ts'o; known as the first North American developer of the Linux kernel; takes over the post
Industry: Non Profit : Charitable Organizations and Foundations
The full text of the press release: Linux Foundation names new CTO; Ted Ts'o; known as the first North American developer of the Linux kernel; takes over the post /br18 December 2008/brInfoWorld Daily News/brEnglish/brThe Linux Foundation has selected a new CTO; Ted Ts'o; who has been known as the first North American developer of the Linux kernel; the foundation said on Thursday./brTs'o has served as a foundation fellow and chief platform strategist. He is considered one of the most highly regarded members of the Linux and open source community; according to the foundation. He replaces Markus Rex; who has returned to Novell to work as acting general manager and senior vice president of Novell's Open Platform Solutions business unit./br[ Related: Take InfoWorld's Linux Admin IQ test ]/brTs'o will lead technical initiatives for the foundation including oversight of the LSB (Linux Standard Base) and workgroups such as Open Printing. He also will interface with foundation members and the foundation's Technical Advisory Board; which represents the kernel community; the foundation said./brTs'o said he believed in the power of mass collaboration and the work that can be done by a community of developers; users; and industry members. "I'm looking forward to translating that power into concrete milestones for the LSB specifically and for Linux overall in the year ahead;" he said in a statement./brTs'o; who already has taken over the CTO position; has worked as a senior technical staff member at IBM; working most recently on an enterprise real time Linux solution. Current plans call for him to return to IBM after his two year fellowship at the foundation is over in a year./brHe also has worked as project leader for the Kerberos authentication system used by Linux systems and Windows; the foundation said.
what happened: The Linux Foundation appointed Ted Ts'o as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Ted Ts'o is a Linux kernel programmer who lives in the Boston.
about company: The Linux Foundation is the nonprofit consortium dedicated to fostering the growth of Linux.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: WRI appoints CTO
Industry: Travel; Recreation & Leisure : Travel Agents and Services
The full text of the press release: WRI appoints CTO/br28.07.2010 /brWeb Reservations International (WRI) has announced the appointment of John O’Donnell as chief technology officer (CTO). /brIn his new position; O’Donnell will be responsible for leading WRI's technology strategy through the company’s next phase of growth. He will report directly to WRI’s CEO Feargal Mooney./brO’Donnell joins the company from Paddy Power where he was head of technology from 2000. During this time; he developed the organization’s technology capabilities from a handful of employees to a 100 strong multi discipline development and support function. This capability underpinned the growth of its e commerce online business from a fledgling channel in 2000 to a €1bn turnover business delivering more than 70pc of corporate profits in 2009./brHe also developed and delivered a mission critical product and pricing global delivery system that was the basis for Paddy Power’s B2B business channel; which enabled its 2010 strategic alliance with the French conglomerate PMU. /brPrior to joining Paddy Power; O’Donnell worked in New York as technology operations manager for Lehman Brothers and was responsible for the project implementation of a newly developed trading platform (OptiMark) onto the Nasdaq stock exchange in 1999./brAt WRI; O’Donnell will be responsible for crafting the technology strategy and roadmap for enhancing the company’s overall competitive position. Key to this in 2010 is the relaunch of WRI’s flagship brand Hostelworld.com and associated international sites./brO’Donnell starts at a time when WRI is set to increase its workforce by 25pc this year. According to WRI; he will be integral to this growth; with the majority of the jobs within the IT and software development department. /br“We’re delighted to have John joining the team at WRI;” said Feargal Mooney. “He brings with him a broad level of expertise; which will be paramount in driving our technology strategy over the coming years. His wealth of experience; proven record for success and passion for technology make him the perfect fit for WRI; enabling us to fully realise the opportunities for growth and innovation that lie before us.”
what happened: Web Reservations International appointed John O’Donnell as Chief Technology Officer
about person: John O’Donnell was previously with Paddy Power where he was head of technology from 2000.
about company: Web Reservations International provides technology; distribution and marketing solutions*to*accommodation and other travel suppliers worldwide through a network of owned sites and affiliate partners.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Bryan Broderick of Telorean Associates Announces New CIO
The full text of the press release: Bryan Broderick of Telorean Associates Announces New CIO/br/brTelorean Associates has announced the appointment of Jeffrey Walsh as Chief Information Officer for its Information Technology consulting business./br/brSeattle; WA; March 28; 2010   (PR.com)   He will be responsible for enterprise IT consulting operations supporting internal and customer business processes and will also ensure that Telorean Associates' IT infrastructure is consistent with Federal; Department of Defense; and Intelligence Community architecture frameworks./br/br""We are very pleased to be able to name a new CIO with the extensive background in information technology in the financial industry that Jeff brings. He is a terrific addition to Telorean. Jeff brings outstanding leadership skills and in depth knowledge of information technology;" said Bryan Broderick;CEO of Telorean Associates. "His strong credentials and expertise in cutting edge technology will help us as we evolve our IT consulting strategy and solutions." he added./br/brMr. Walsh brings over 20 years of experience in management level IT and operational positions where he achieved success in start up; turnaround and high growth ventures. Walsh has a Bachelor of Science in Finance & Marketing from Boston College./br/brAbout Telorean Associates LLC/brTelorean Associates specializes in Information Technology Systems. The company designs; installs; updates; and manages multi faceted telecommunication systems nationwide. Telorean has a team of sales and support professionals located all over the United States and is committed to developing superior communications systems for any type of business. Headed by President Byran Broderick; Telorean is currently headquartered in Seattle; Washington./br/brhttp://broderick10.wordpress.com/
what happened: Telorean Associates appointed Jeffrey Walsh as Chief Information Officer
about person: Jeffrey Walsh has over 20 years of experience in management level IT and operational positions where he achieved success in start up; turnaround and high growth ventures. Walsh has a Bachelor of Science in Finance & Marketing from Boston College.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: VIST Financial Hires Chief Information Officer
The full text of the press release: VIST Financial Hires Chief Information Officer/br WYOMISSING; Pa.; Sept. 7 /PRNewswire FirstCall/    VIST Financial Corp. (Nasdaq: VIST) announced today the appointment of John F. Acanfora as Chief Information Officer. Acanfora will be responsible for overall strategy; leadership; management and execution related to existing and new technology for the insurance; banking; and wealth management lines of business within VIST Financial. /brPrior to joining VIST Financial; Acanfora has served in executive level information technology roles with the Morning Call Newspaper; Allentown; the former Keystone Savings Bank; Bethlehem and Air Products and Chemicals Inc.; Allentown where he provided leadership in operations; information technology; project planning and management service support./brA resident of Breinigsville; PA; Acanfora serves in leadership roles within the community including the Kutztown University Foundation; Kutztown Folk Festival; Lehigh County Conference of Churches; as well as memberships in various organizations within the community and the technology field. He holds a Bachelor of Business Administration from Pace University; New York and has attended various banking; technology and executive development programs. /br"We are pleased that John has joined VIST Financial and believe his demonstrated leadership and communication skills coupled with his IT expertise will provide us with additional strategic direction in ensuring reliable; secure infrastructure and business applications that will ultimately allow us to provide the best customer experience no matter where or how our client chooses to do business with VIST;" stated Edward C. Barrett; Executive Vice President; Chief Financial Officer. /brVIST Financial is a $1.3 billion diversified financial services company headquartered in Wyomissing; PA; offering banking; insurance and wealth management services throughout Berks; Southern Schuylkill; Montgomery; Delaware; and Philadelphia Counties./brFor additional information about the company: www.vistfc.com/brSOURCE VIST Financial Corp./brBack to top /brRELATED LINKS/brhttp://www.vistfc.com
what happened: VIST Financial appointed John Acanfora as Chief Information Officer
about person: John Acanfora was previously in various technology leadership roles with Morning Call Newspaper; Allentown; the former Keystone Savings Bank; Bethlehem and Air Products and Chemicals Inc.
about company: VIST Financial is a $1.3 billion diversified financial services company headquartered in Wyomissing; PA; offering banking; insurance and wealth management services throughout Berks; Southern Schuylkill; Montgomery; Delaware; and Philadelphia Counties.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Motionless wind energy device startup recruits Accuri Cytometers' Jennifer Baird to become CEO
The full text of the press release: Motionless wind energy device startup recruits Accuri Cytometers' Jennifer Baird to become CEO/brPosted: Sep 15; 2010 at 6:00 AM [Sep 15; 2010] /brJennifer Baird; co founder and former CEO of Accuri Cytometers; will lead Accio Energy; which is developing a device that uses the wind to generate electricity without moving parts. This photo shows a model of the "aerovoltaic" device./brNathan Bomey | AnnArbor.com/brOne of the Ann Arbor region’s top entrepreneurial executives has agreed to become CEO of Accio Energy; which is developing a wind energy device that generates electricity without moving parts. /brAccio plans to announce today that Jennifer Baird; who co founded and led Scio Township based Accuri Cytometers as CEO until stepping aside in January; will become its new CEO./brAccio’s previous CEO; co founder Dawn White; will stay on as president and chief technology officer. /brWhite said she was “beyond thrilled” to have Baird; who was working with Accio as a consultant for the last several months; step in as CEO./br“It just became really clear that Jen and I have complementary skill sets and some overlap;” said White; who remains on Accio’s board. “We really like working together and we have an opportunity to solve our problem of extending the management team without any disruption to the business."/brThe leadership transition comes as the 9 person company is poised to ramp up its efforts to secure venture capital funding to support its technology development. The company recently signed a lease for a 12;000 square foot office and R&D space on Airport Boulevard in Pittsfield Township./brBaird raised more than $30 million in funding for Accuri and built the medical devices company from scratch into an 80 person firm in five years. Accuri; which topped $10 million in sales in 2010 for its cell analysis device; is now led by Jeff Williams; who became CEO in January two months after his previous firm; HandyLab; was sold to Becton; Dickinson and Co. for $275 million./brBaird said she became convinced over the last several months that Accio’s technology had significant commercial promise./br“The opportunities are tremendous;” she saiyology’s product development and strategic technology vision; revolutionizing the measurement of non conscious motivations to provide more impactful insights for marketers. This includes creating ground breaking large sample testing methods and implementing other cutting edge software advances./br/brRaichoudhury brings not only technology but investor experience to Buyology. He is a prominent angel investor and has been a limited partner at Silicon Valley Angel Investors; an early stage funder of Google. He has served as technical adviser to many companies; including WhenU.com; a pioneer of web based contextual advertising./br/br"Raj is a key addition to Buyology as we further position ourselves to be the only company to quantify non conscious consumer behavior through proprietary technology and provocative insight;” said Gary Singer; CEO; Buyology Inc. “Given his global reputation as an innovator; and his successful track record with past endeavors; he’s a perfect fit for Buyology and we’re thrilled to have him on board.”/br/br“Through Raj’s leadership and vision; Buyology will be able to utilize the massive power of computerized analysis to uncover insights that were never before available using traditional marketing methods;” added Martin Lindstrom; Chairman; Buyology Inc. “We anticipate tremendous interest from brands across the globe as we introduce new products in the coming year and through 2011.”/br/brFollowing the successful sale of WebCal to Yahoo!; Raichoudhury co founded Bartleby.com; a popular website for reference; verse and prose; Attap.com; a next generation personal information platform; Keytoss.com; a modular mobility portal for smartphones; Phobos Entertainment; a multimedia producer of science fiction content; and TGS; Inc. a producer of multiplayer online games./br/br“Buyology's vision and potential for impact parallel some of the world changing ideas that took root in the early days of the commercial Internet;” said Raichoudhury. “I’m thrilled to join this outstanding group and make a true impact on marketing.”/br/brAbout Buyology/br/brBuyology Inc.; the world’s leading strategic neuromarketing company; is in the business of quantifying; improving; and actively managing sustainable relationships between brands and their customers. Buyology utilizes its global neuroscience database to develop rigorous tools that bridge science and business so as to provide a provocative and proprietary understanding of consumer decision making and brand relationships. Buyology helps significantly enhance marketing’s transformational business impact.
what happened: BUYOLOGY INC appointed Rajesh Raichoudhury as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Rajesh Raichoudhury brings not only technology but investor experience to Buyology. He is a prominent angel investor and has been a limited partner at Silicon Valley Angel Investors; an early stage funder of Google.
about company: Buyology Inc.; the world’s leading strategic neuromarketing company; is in the business of quantifying; improving; and actively managing sustainable relationships between brands and their customers. Buyology utilizes its global neuroscience database to develop rigorous tools that bridge science and business so as to provide a provocative and proprietary understanding of consumer decision making and brand relationships. Buyology helps significantly enhance marketing’s transformational business impact.

title: Senior Vice President   Technology
headline: Hachette’s CTO Tom Donohue Joins Cablevision’s Local Media Group
The full text of the press release: Hachette’s CTO Tom Donohue Joins Cablevision’s Local Media Group /brCablevision (NYSE: CVC) is building up its local media group and has hired Tom Donohue from Hachette Filipacchi Media U.S. to oversee the unit’s technology and the strategy around it. No successor has been named at HFMUS; which also just shifted out Alain Lemarchand as president and CEO of HFMUS and replaced him with former Primedia (NYSE: PRM) exec Steve Parr. Donohue officially steps into his new job on Monday. /brCablevision’s local group includes a wide array of holdings; including News 12 Networks’ local news channels; MSG Varsity’s suite of television and online services covering high school news and events. There’s also the Newsday Media Group; which in addition to the flagship daily runs free commuter paper amNewYork. /brThe local group serves as a support system and incremental source of revenue for Cablevision. The support comes in the form of extending Cablevision’s offerings beyond the main MSO business and serves to attract customers and local advertisers./brDonohue’s hire comes a week after Cablevision moved Valerie Green over from MSG’s Fuse music channel to run marketing for the local media group. She also begins her new post next week.
what happened: Cablevision appointed Tom Donohue as Senior Vice President   Technology.
about person: Tom Donohue was previously the CTO at Hachette Filipacchi Media
about company: Cablevision Systems Corporation is one of the nation's leading telecommunications; media and entertainment companies. In addition to its Optimum branded cable; Internet; and voice offerings; the company owns and operates News 12 Networks; MSG Varsity and Newsday Media Group.

The full text of the press release: New York's Canton Potsdam Hospital Names CIO/brWritten by Rachel Fields | August 23; 2010 /brJorge C. Grillo has joined Canton Potsdam (N.Y.) Hospital as chief information officer; according to a North County Now report. /br/brMr. Grillo will be responsible for the implementation of an electronic medical record. Prior to joining CPH; Mr. Grillo served as CIO of the Island of Bermuda's Hospital System; supporting two hospitals and three outpatient facilities with a patient population of around 70;000. /br/brHe has also served as director of information technology services for Asante Health System; based in Medford; Ore.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: CareCentrix Appoints Chief Information Officer
Industry: Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech : Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech Other
The full text of the press release: CareCentrix Appoints Chief Information Officer/brHome Health Benefits Management Company Expands Executive Team to Support Continued Growth/brHARTFORD; Conn.; Oct. 14 /PRNewswire/    CareCentrix; Inc.; the nation's leading provider of home health benefits management services; announced today that it has expanded its executive team with the addition of Santosh Dave. The company has appointed Dave to chief information officer. /brDave will be responsible for expanding CareCentrix's technology services to support the company's increasing number of customers. He brings to CareCentrix nearly 20 years of information technology leadership experience. Dave previously led and developed information technology services for Viant; Inc.; a healthcare payment solutions company. In his prior position; he was responsible for systems; technology and security for more than 3;200 facilities for Wells Fargo. He has also held leadership positions with GE and Sprint; as well as two IT consulting practices in India. /br"As we continue to expand our services to include new programs like hospital readmission prevention and wound care management; we are committed to investing in and enhancing our technology to support our growing base of customers;" said Eric Reimer; chief executive officer; CareCentrix. "Santosh's experience identifying and implementing high performing technology solutions will be important to achieving our objective of providing our health plan customers with best in class service to effectively manage their members' home health needs. He is an outstanding addition to lead our experienced information technology team."/br"CareCentrix is uniquely positioned to grow by serving our current and prospective customers well. Expanding the use of technology to actively manage the entire life cycle of care for our patients will continue to enable us to deliver quality care while controlling healthcare costs. Innovation; operational excellence; and speed to market will be my primary focus at CareCentrix;" said Dave. /brAbout CareCentrix/brFounded in 1996; CareCentrix manages home nursing; infusion and medical equipment services for more than 20 million people across the country through a network of 5;000 credentialed home care providers. The company provides health care plans and providers with a one stop solution that coordinates care for patients in the home including skilled nursing services; durable medical equipment and home infusion drug therapies. CareCentrix recently expanded its services with the development of a new program that will help payers and providers reduce the rising rate of hospital readmissions. CareCentrix is headquartered in East Hartford; Connecticut; and has operations in Melville; New York; Phoenix; Arizona; Tampa; Florida; and Albuquerque; New Mexico with a new regional care center that opened in Overland Park; Kansas this year. For more information about CareCentrix visit www.carecentrix.com.
what happened: CareCentrix appointed Santosh Dave as Chief Information Officer
about person: Santosh Dave previously led and developed information technology services for Viant; Inc.; a healthcare payment solutions company.
about company: CareCentrix manages home nursing; infusion and medical equipment services for more than 20 million people across the country through a network of 5;000 credentialed home care providers.

title: Vice President of Technology
headline: Cars.com Names Kayne Grau Vice President of Technology
The full text of the press release: Cars.com Taps VP of Technology/brOctober 12; 2010 | CHICAGO /brCars.com revealed its vice president of technology late last week. Appointed to the role is Kayne Grau; who has been with the company since 2008./brIn the new position; Grau's duties include leading strategy and guiding projects for the company's information technology initiatives./br“Kayne brings to the task an impressive track record here and extensive experience managing technology groups;” noted Bill Swislow; the chief information officer and and senior vice president for product at Cars.com. /br“His knowledge of our business and organizational skills will help us continue to meet the evolving needs of our shoppers and advertising dealers and manufacturers;” he continued./brWhen Grau came aboard Cars.com; he was the director of development and the next year began heading up technical operations and quality assurance; as well./brSwislow said Grau has worked with his team to help core site performance become steady and to create focus and efficiency in application development. /brMoreover; he and his team have broadened the capabilities in the quality assurance arena; according to Swislow. /brOfficials also noted Cars.com is looking for professionals to fill other IT roles; as well. /br“The planned growth for the Cars.com technology team reflects the tremendous strides we've made in the past two years;” Grau shared. “I’m proud to work with these talented professionals as we expand the department's capabilities and accelerate program deliverables.”
what happened: Cars.com promoted Kayne Grau to Vice President of Technology
about person: Kayne Grau joined Cars.com in 2008 as the director of development; in 2009; he added technical operations and quality assurance to his responsibilities.
about company: Cars.com is the leading destination for online car shoppers; offering credible; easy to understand information from consumers and experts to help buyers formulate opinions on what to buy; where to buy and how much to pay for a car.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: CIOs are getting jobs!
The full text of the press release: Mon; Oct 25; 2010 14:38 EDT/brCIOs are getting jobs!/brDespite employment reports; the IT executive hiring market is picking up /brCIOs are getting jobs! It’s true! Despite the dismal employment reports that plague our morning newspapers; the IT executive hiring market seems to be picking up. My colleagues in executive search report an uptick in CIO search engagements; and at my firm; we are busier than we have been since late 2008. There are still more kings than kingdoms; and some fantastic talent “on the street;" to be sure. But with the consumerization of technology forcing every company to innovate in IT; companies know that they need the right IT talent; and they are willing to pay for it. /brOnto the news….USIS; an Altegrity company; has announced that Cheryl Cohen is their new Chief Information Officer (CIO) reporting to USIS President and CEO Bill Mixon. Cohen has 26 years of experience in IT; with the last 13 years spent at ManTech International and DynCorp. Most recently; she served as vice president of information systems at ManTech. /brHuron Consulting Group; a business consulting services provider; announced Vincent A. Martin has been appointed as the Company's CIO. Martin is a consulting industry veteran with more than 20 years of professional services experience working in various IT roles where he helped companies with their information management organization; and provided integral support by carrying out the IT strategy and implementation. Martin was most recently at McKinsey & Co. as Director of Information Technology./brDTT Surveillance; an industry leader in the surveillance space; recently announced the appointment of a new CIO; Matthew Kravitz. Kravitz has 15 years of executive and consulting experience helping companies build better customer relationships; increase revenue; and decrease costs by realizing operational efficiencies./brMichael Fillios has been named CIO; Enterprise Functions of ITT; reporting to Carol Zierhoffer; Vice President and Global Chief Information Officer. In this expanded role; Fillios will continue to provide strategic business relationship management; support and advisory services to ITT’s functional organizations and global shared services. In addition; Fillios will now lead the global IT strategic planning and governance processes and is responsible for creating and aligning the technology vision and plan with the ITT business and functional strategies. Ensuring tight integration of the planning and execution cycle; he will also assume responsibility for oversight of the IT enterprise governance and portfolio project management activities./brChristopher Grant McDaniel has recently been named Head of IT Planning and Strategy for Qatar Project Management (QPM) based in Doha; edge technologies to advance the firm's core initiatives./brJoseph Fung joins Colonial Consulting from the Burgiss Group; where he was managing director of product development and IT for the provider of private equity software and alternative assets solutions. At the Burgiss Group; he was instrumental in advancing Software as a Service (SaaS) in its offerings; including bringing out the new SaaS versions of their flagship software. Prior to the Burgiss Group; Mr. Fung was CTO at Ness Technologies USA; where he; in addition to guiding the internal technical vision; provided technology consulting to IT and business executives in a variety of industries./br"We are excited to have such an accomplished and respected technologist join the Colonial team;" said Dine Grullon. "Joe's experience complements our goal to service our clients with leading edge technologies."/brFrom Mr. Grullon's strong belief that the firm is in many ways intertwined with information services; Colonial Consulting has been pioneering the use of technology to support its investment consulting services for almost two decades. With the addition of Mr. Fung; the use of innovative technologies will grow and enhance the firm's ability to serve clients in an increasingly complex investment climate so that they can achieve their charitable missions./brAbout Colonial Consulting; LLC/brColonial Consulting is a leading investment consulting firm founded in 1980 with a focus on strong performance. With our experience; expertise; and in depth research; we provide exceptional investment advice and full service consulting so that our clients can meet their financial objectives and long term ability to achieve their mission. Approximately 90% of our clients' assets are in endowments or foundations. As a result; our firm is structured to specifically work with the requirements and challenges of these institutions. Our efforts are focused on a number of areas and are driven by the deeply rooted philosophy that we exist to serve clients and that their success defines our own.
what happened: Colonial Consulting appointed Joseph Fung as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Joseph Fung was previously with Burgiss Group; where he was managing director of product development and IT for the provider of private equity software and alternative assets solutions.
about company: Colonial Consulting is a leading investment consulting firm founded in 1980 with a focus on strong performance.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: CSU Pueblo Chief Information Officer retires
The full text of the press release: CSU Pueblo Chief Information Officer retires/br Throughout the last nine months I have reported to the Board of Governors the numerous issues that the students have had with campus technology. On Monday; September 27; 2010 the Chief Information (Technology) officer notified the campus of his impending retirement. Even though he and I have not seen eye to eye on many issues regarding campus technology; I appreciate the years of service he has dedicated to our campus./br/br Moving on with replacing the CIO I hope that a nation wide search begins as soon as fiscally possible and that there is adequate ASG representation on that search committee. ASG represents a nearly $700;000 allocation to IT and should be represented appropriately.
what happened: David Niccoli retired as Chief Information Officer of CSU Pueblo.
about person: David Niccoli was previously in various technology positions at the CSU Pueblo for 30 years.
about company: Colorado State University–Pueblo (CSU–Pueblo) is a regional; comprehensive public institution of higher learning located in Pueblo; Colorado. CSU Pueblo is a member of the Colorado State University System (CSU System); along with Colorado State University (CSU) in Fort Collins; the system's flagship; and Colorado State University Global Campus.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Executive Moves
The full text of the press release: October 10; 2010 5:59 AM/brExecutive Moves/brExecutives in accounting; advertising; finance; high tech & new media; law and real estate have all found new digs. Check out the new faces in key places./brOxygen Media: Elissa Harman; 33; joins as vice president of consumer marketing. Previously; she served as director of consumer marketing at Comedy Central. /brAutumn Games: Jeffrey Ulin; 48; has been appointed executive vice president of the video game publisher. He formerly served as Lucasfilm's senior distribution executive./brRussell Investments: Kurt Zyla; 49; has been hired as regional director for listed derivatives. He most recently worked for BNY Mellon; Mellon Capital Management in San Francisco; as head of investment strategy for indexes and electronic transfers of funds. /brPwC: Martyn Curragh; 45; has been appointed leader of the U.S. transaction services practice. He has been with PwC for 20 years; most recently as a partner with PwC transaction services and market leader for the New York office./brGolinHarris: Paul Patella; 35; has been promoted to senior vice president. He has been with the public relations agency since 2006; formerly serving as vice president./brGrant & Eisenhofer: Daniel Berger; 55; has joined the law firm as a director in New York. He has spent the last four years as a member of Pomerantz Haudek./brFordham Law School: Vera T. Bullock; 40; has been named assistant dean for advancement and assistant vice president for external relations. She was previously the director of advancement and external affairs at The Chapin School./brGlobal Rainmakers Inc.: James M. Demitrieus; 62; has been named chief operating officer at the intellectual property holding company. He was formerly president of Sherwood Valves; a division of Harsco Corp. /brSapientNitro: Jake Benjamin; 36; joined the customer experience company as creative director. Prior to joining SapientNitro; he was a copywriter for Goodby Silverstein & Partners. /brCommunity Preservation Corp.: Christopher O'Keefe; 34; has been promoted to the newly created position of chief information officer. He was formerly director; information management and security. /brJunior Achievement of New York: Gabrielle Belson Rattner; 51; has been appointed vice president of resource development. She was previously director of recruitment at New York University's College of Arts and Sciences; and vice president of external affairs at the Regional Plan Association. /brBlank Rome: Alan J. Hoffman; 62; has been elected to serve as chairman. He was previously co chairman. /brCorigin Holdings: Gregory Gleason; 31; has been named director of finance for the real estate investment and private equity company. He was formerly an associate at Credit Suisse Private Equity./brMiller Buckfire & Co.: Kevin Stahl; 39; joined the investment banking firm as managing director. He was previously with RBC Capital Markets; where he was managing director and co head of U.S. real estate investment banking./brFleishman Hillard: Guillaume Herbette; 44; has been named vice chairman of operations for the strategic communications firm. He has been with the company since 1998; serving most recently as chief operating officer for the East; West and Canada regions in North America. /brSeyfarth Shaw: Jason Lichter; 32; has joined the law firm as of counsel in the electronic discovery practice group. He arrives from Weil Gotshal & Manges; where he was a senior associate. /brDoremus: Oliver Snoddy; 29; has joined as director of digital services at the Omnicom business communications firm. He joins from OMD London; where he was digital planning director./brArnold & Porter: Robert Azarow; 49; is now partner at the law firm. He was formerly a partner at Sonnenschein Nath & Rosenthal. /brEdward W. Bright; 53; joins as partner. He was previously a partner at Sonnenschein Nath & Rosenthal. Stephanie Nygard; 40; joins as counsel. She was formerly a partner at Sonnenschein Nath & Rosenthal. /brAdGenesis: Alec T. Coughlin; 31; has been brought aboard the video advertising network as vice president; business development. Most recently; he was senior vice president; Worldgroup EXP; at McCann Worldgroup. /brAsia TV USA Ltd.: Jerry Blake; 46; has been appointed general counsel. He was previously general counsel at the Sundance Channel. /brCiti Habitats: Gordon Golub; 40; has been promoted to executive vice president and director of rentals. He has been with the real estate brokerage since 1994 and was most recently senior managing director. /brVedder Price: Thomas J. Kowalski; 48; joined the law firm as shareholder in the intellectual property group. He was previously a partner at Frommer Lawrence & Haug. /brEspirito Santo Investment: Thomas Friebel; 43; is now managing director at the Portugal based investment bank. He was formerly managing director of European commercial bank WestLB./brLeClairRyan: Brian C. Daughney; 48; has been brought in as shareholder at the law firm. He was previously a partner at Haynes and Boone. /brDavid Beahm Design: Christina Matteucci; 31; has been promoted to executive director for the event design company. She was previously senior client services manager. /brEcoHealth Alliance: Joanne L. Mazurki; 58; was hired as executive vice presi  dent of development and marketing for the nonprofit international conservation organization. She was most recently president of Joanne Mazurki Consulting./brDr. William Karesh; 55; has been hired as executive vice president for health and policy; a newly created position. He was most recently vice president for global health at the Wildlife Conservation Society./brHealthCare Chaplaincy: Robert Wolf; 59; is now senior vice president for innovation and development at the palliative care provider. Most recently; he was director of special projects at AARP Foundation.
what happened: Community Preservation Corp promoted Christopher O'Keefe to Chief Information Officer
about person: Christopher O'Keefe was formerly director; information management and security.
about company: Community Preservation Corp is a HUD approved mortgage lender.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Nation’s Largest Financial Technology Management Provider Hires Well Known Industry Thought Leader to Take Company to Next Level
The full text of the press release: Nation’s Largest Financial Technology Management Provider Hires Well Known Industry Thought Leader to Take Company to Next Level/br/brby on October 25; 2010/br/brThis is from/brMarketwire – Management Changes:/br/br SANTA ANA; CA–(Marketwire – October 25; 2010) – Mr. Kevin Prince joins Compushare; Inc. as the Chief Technology Officer to oversee all product research and development efforts as well as the execution of new offerings and solution enhancements. Compushare is the leading national Financial Technology Management solutions provider for the financial services industry. /br
what happened: Compushare; Inc. appointed Kevin Prince as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Previously; Kevin Prince was founder and CEO of Red Cliff Solutions which provided firewall; intrusion detection and prevention; web content filtering; anti virus; virtual private networks; and vulnerability assessments to financial institutions; all with 24/7 management and monitoring.
about company: Compushare is the leading national Financial Technology Management solutions provider for the financial services industry.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: comScore (SCOR) Announces $36.7M Acquisition of Nedstat
Industry: Software & Internet : E commerce and Internet Businesses
The full text of the press release: comScore (SCOR) Announces $36.7M Acquisition of Nedstat/br/br/brSeptember 1; 2010 7:20 AM EDT /brcomScore; Inc. (Nasdaq: SCOR) announces $36.7 million acquisition of Nedstat./br/brNedstat offers world class technology that helps organizations optimize customer experiences and maximize the return on digital media investments./br/brAccording to the release: "Upon the acquisition; Nedstat became a wholly owned subsidiary of comScore. Mr. Kinsbergen will be helping in the transition and will continue to be involved by joining comScore's advisory board. In addition; Fred Appelman; Nedstat's Chief Technology Officer; and Michiel Berger; Nedstat's co founder and Chief Innovations Officer; will join comScore in senior strategy and technology roles./br/brcomScore believes that the Nedstat acquisition will contribute approximately $4 million of additional revenue for the remainder of 2010. comScore anticipates that due to transaction related expenses and transaction related accounting adjustments the transaction will be dilutive to 2010 GAAP and non GAAP net income; but accretive to quarterly GAAP and non GAAP net income within the first half of 2011."
what happened: comScore acquired Nedstat and its CTO Fred Appelman is joining comScore's senior team.
about person: Fred Appelman was previously the CTO of Nedstat
about company: comScore; Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a global leader in measuring the digital world and preferred source of digital marketing intelligence. comScore helps its clients better understand; leverage and profit from the rapidly evolving digital marketing landscape by providing solutions in the measurement and evaluation of online audiences; advertising effectiveness; social media; search; video; mobile; e commerce ; and a broad variety of other emerging forms of digital behavior.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Shillington named Cybera VP of technology
The full text of the press release: Shillington named Cybera VP of technology/brOctober 18; 2010   5:56pm — The Wire Report/br/brCybera Inc. announced last week it has named John Shillington as vice president; technology.
what happened: Patrick Mann resigned as Chief Technology Officer of Cybera
about person: Patrick Mann was previously a Director at UNBC.
about company: Cybera is the leading provider of networking and security services for distributed enterprises.

title: Vice President of Technology
headline: Shillington named Cybera VP of technology
Industry: Computers & Electronics : IT and Network Services and Support
The full text of the press release: 27 October; 2010 Last updated 6 hours 22 minutes ago /br/brHaving Trouble Logging In?/brShillington named Cybera VP of technology/brOctober 18; 2010   5:56pm — The Wire Report/br/brCybera Inc. announced last week it has named John Shillington as vice president; technology./brPurchase this article for $25/br
what happened: Cybera Inc. appointed John Shillington as Vice President of Technology
about person: John Shillington was previously the Cyberinfrastructure Architect at Cybera.
about company: Cybera is the leading provider of networking and security services for distributed enterprises. Through its turn key solutions; Cybera provides a simple and affordable way for enterprises to securely connect multi location businesses while meeting regulatory and compliance requirements; including PCI and HIPAA.

title: Vice President of Technology
headline: Cygnus Business Media Executes Second Phase of Organizational Architecture
The full text of the press release: October 28; 2010 01:19 PM Eastern Daylight Time /brCygnus Business Media Executes Second Phase of Organizational Architecture/br/brDigital establishes core team; Flitcroft Named EVP of Construction Affinity Group/br/brFORT ATKINSON; Wis.  (BUSINESS WIRE)  On July 15th; Cygnus Business Media’s CEO; John French; outlined a dynamic and unique organizational architecture for the company that would consist of four affinity groups – Aviation; Construction; Public Safety & Security and Agriculture – and a Diversified Portfolio comprised of strong; stand alone titles. Over the past 100 days; Cygnus implemented the First Phase of the architecture establishing Cygnus Aviation with industry veteran Pat Nadler as Executive Vice President and creating the Diversified Portfolio unit with B2B media expert Gloria Cosby tapped to lead the group./br/br“The next 100 days should be equally as productive with our digital intelligence growing much more detailed and targeted; and our Construction affinity group showcasing opportunities for our customers interested in a top tier media option.”/brFrench announced the execution of the Second Phase of the company’s new organizational architecture with the appointment of Construction industry insider; Kris Flitcroft; to head the Construction affinity group. Flitcroft most recently served as Brand Director for the company’s Construction network. She has directed and managed the Cygnus’ valuable construction publications and websites and was key in the sponsorship launch of ForConstructionPros.com’s first ever Video Network. Under Flitcroft’s guidance; ForConstructionPros.com has become the industry’s most innovative construction website with a SEO driven Buyer’s Guide; a top branded used and new equipment electronic marketplace and exclusive content focused on government legislation; product reviews and targeted programming for construction industry professionals. Flitcroft; Cosby and Nadler report to Cygnus Business Media’s President; Mike Martin./br/brThe Second Phase of Cygnus’ organizational architecture implementation focuses on the company’s digital assets; opportunities and strategic alliances. In June; Cygnus Business Media hired digital media expert; Tom Kohn; to lead the company’s digital initiatives as Executive Vice President/Digital. Kohn spent 25 years conceiving of and launching media businesses and corporate media divisions for the world’s top media brands; including USATODAY.com and AOL. He launched two successful start ups in Washington; DC; and served as strategic consultant for the Associated Press. He has also worked with Viacom New Media and spent 10 years in New York City as a television executive; three with Ogilvy & Mather Advertising./br/brKohn has appointed Eric Kammerzelt to the position of Vice President of Technology. Kammerzelt has directed many of the company digital assets; most recently as the lead project manager behind the proprietary Base 2.0 system. He was named to the Folio 40 in March of this year./br/brPaul Caplan will become Senior Vice President of Digital Revenues. Caplan oversaw the launch of SecurityInfoWatch.com and the successful launch of U38industry branded enewsletters; podcasts; ebooks and more. He will be responsible for delivering revenues on all digital programs that span across all of Cygnus./br/brJacob Bare has been named Director of Digital Intelligence; a newly created position that will work closely with Cygnus’ data integration partner Omeda as it consolidates company lists and collaborates with Base 2.0 to give the company significant intelligence on user behaviors and interests and be able to serve customized content and advertising based on this data./br/brSharon Wright will move into the Director of Digital Operations role; managing all operations as it relates to corporate initiatives. Wright is currently the Director of Web Development and Strategy for Public Safety. She has worked in the company’s digital/interactive area since its early days moving from   Web Specialist; Site Manager; Senior Site Manager; Project Manager and Business Development Manager; Interactive./br/brRobert Brice; who currently directs Cygnus Fire and EMS public safety media including expos; magazines and websites has been tapped as Senior Vice President; Cygnus Expositions. The public safety expos that Brice has overseen – EMS EXPO; Firehouse World; Firehouse Central and Firehouse Expo – continue to lead the industry with a distinct and influential community of thousand of First Responders. He also has a diverse background that includes publishing and portals; experience necessary as the company integrates all media under one structure. Brice will also report directly to Cygnus Business Media President; Mike Martin./br/br“I am happy to communicate that we have finished implementing our First Phase of a new organizational architecture;” says French. “The next 100 days should be equally as productive with our digital intelligence growing much more detailed and targeted; and our Construction affinity group showcasing opportunities for our customers interested in a top tier media option.”/br/brCygnus Business Media reaches millions of professionals annually. As one of America’s top business to business media companies; Cygnus is leading the way in providing targeted content to top decision makers and organizations. The company’s corporate initiatives and organizational architecture are built with one goal: fully engaging audiences in Aviation; Building & Construction; Public Safety & Security; Agriculture vertical markets and a variety of other industries./br/brContacts/brCygnus Business Media/brKathy Scott; 770 427 5290/brKathy.Scott@cygnusb2b.com/br/brPermalink: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20101028006681/en/Cygnus Business Media Executes Phase Organizational Architecture
what happened: Cygnus Business Media appointed Eric Kammerzelt as Vice President of Technology
about person: Eric Kammerzelt has directed many of the company digital assets; most recently as the lead project manager behind the proprietary Base 2.0 system. He was named to the Folio 40 in March of this year.
about company: Cygnus Business Media publishes 80 business to business media products including trade magazines; directories and cards; and produces 50 trade shows within 15 major markets.

title: Director of Technology
headline: Cytta Delineates Medical Home Ecosystem; Adds New Director of Technology
Industry: Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech : Medical Supplies & Equipment
The full text of the press release: Sep 21; 2010 09:30 ET/brCytta Delineates Medical Home Ecosystem; Adds New Director of Technology/br/brPALM DESERT; CA  (Marketwire   September 21; 2010)   Cytta Corp's (OTCBB: CYCA) President; Gary Campbell; is pleased to announce that recent developments in the US healthcare system and managerially have allowed the Company to clearly delineate and greatly expand their business model of being an integration and solutions provider within the entire patient centered medical home ecosystem./br/brCytta sees the patient centered medical home ecosystem (PCMHE) as an integrated network of eHealth technologies and services capable of being utilized to organize primary care to ensure patients receive coordinated care from a primary care physician supported by advanced monitoring technologies for self care management; provided by a skilled healthcare team./br/brThe goal of the patient centered medical home ecosystem is to create the mechanism to deliver continuous; accessible; high quality; patient oriented primary care to lower costs and improve quality of care through the adoption of health IT; care teams and evidence based medical guidelines./br/brThe Company is pleased to announce that Mr. Mike Stiege has joined the Board of Advisors as Director of Technology to assist with and refine our technical objectives. Mr. Stephen Spalding; CEO; stated; "I have worked with; and known Mr. Stiege for many years and we at Cytta are fortunate to have his remarkable wisdom and vision assisting in the development of the Cytta Medical Home Ecosystem. Mr. Stiege brings numerous resources to our Company and we are all experiencing the incisive direction and focus which have been the hallmark of all his previous endeavors."/br/brMr. Stiege has 30 years of business management and technology experience in the USA; Canada and internationally. Mr. Stiege has 5 years of "Big Five" management consulting leadership experience in progressively expanding roles; ultimately; he joined one of his clients; Sun Microsystems. He assisted clients with challenges concerning technology governance and organization; return on technology investment; strategic planning; systems development; and technology portfolio management./br/brAt Sun Microsystems; Mr. Stiege initiated and led the business and the technical development of Sun's first hosted ASP business; This was a complete ecosystem; consisting of hardware; software; services; 3rd party partners; content developers; and network operators. The ecosystem included business models; revenue share and support agreements. It was successfully deployed to wireless carriers./br/brRecently; Mr. Stiege has assisted Sybase in development of greenfield technology business opportunities. Bringing new technologies; and or identifying new market opportunities and helping the firm "cross the chasm." His focus was on OEM and ISV based opportunities for mobility and business intelligence and analytics./br/brMr. Stiege holds an MBA from the University of Toronto; and a B.Sc degree in Engineering Physics & Operations Research also from the University of Toronto. He has been a duly licensed member of the Association of Professional Engineers of Ontario and the American Institute of Industrial Engineers./br/brIn further developments; the Board has ratified a one year extension of the contracts of Mr. Campbell and Mr. Harz. Additionally; the Company is no longer a Reseller of the MedApps product and will now be able to offer their clients the 'best of breed' products from senior technologies sourced on a worldwide basis. This change allows the Company to source and recommend advanced technologies from the entire ecosystem of available products and is more in line with our new PCMHE model of integration./br/brContact:/brCytta Corp./brCorporation Communications/brKarl J. Harz/brVice President/brPhone 213 841 0094 begin_of_the_skype_highlighting 213 841 0094 end_of_the_skype_highlighting/brKJHarz9@gmail.com/brWebsite: www.Cytta.com
what happened: Cytta appointed Mike Stiege as Director of Technology
about person: Mike Stiege was previously the with Sun Microsystems; where he initiated and led the business and the technical development of Sun's first hosted ASP business.
about company: Cytta Corporation was created to develop; integrate and enhance medical communication devices.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: CAREER PROGRESSIONS
company name: Office of the Secretary of Defense Networks
The full text of the press release: Senior Executive Service Appointments and Reassignments/br/br Secretary of Defense Robert M. Gates announced the following Department of Defense Senior Executive Service appointments and reassignments:/br/br Reassignments/br/br Ronald G. Bechtold has been assigned as Office of the Secretary of Defense Networks chief information officer; Office of the Director; Administration and Management; Washington; D.C. Bechtold previously served as director; Army Architecture Integration Cell; Department of the Army; Washington; D.C./br/br Mary R. George has been assigned as deputy director; Washington Headquarters Services; Washington; D.C. George previously served as director; Information Technology Management Directorate; Washington Headquarters Services; Washington; D.C.
what happened: Office of the Secretary of Defense Networks appointed Ronald Bechtold as Chief Information Officer
about person: Ronald Bechtold was previously the director; Army Architecture Integration Cell; Department of the Army; Washington; D.C.
about company: Department of Defense Network Information Center provides information and services that are mission critical to the operation of the worldwide IP router Defense Information Systems Network (DISN) and other DoD sponsored networks.

title: Director of Technology
headline: Delaware business achievers
The full text of the press release: Delaware business achievers/br/brNONPROFIT/brThe Delaware Humane Association's Board of Directors elected new officers for 2010:/brDan Cruce is serving his first term as president of the board. Cruce is deputy secretary and chief of staff for the Delaware Department of Education./brRodney Brittingham was elected to his first term as vice president of the board. Brittingham is the deputy director of the Delaware Division of Family Services./brSarah Stafford; secretary; was elected to her first leadership position on the board. Stafford is an attorney with Richards; Layton & Finger./brDawn Shore; treasurer; is serving her first term on the board. Shore is controller for the Brandywine Conservancy./brBrittingham and Stafford join Cruce and Shore on the executive committee./brTECHNOLOGY/brDiamond Technologies in New Castle; a provider of information technology solutions to business and government; has named three managers to director positions in the organization./brTim Reiter of Avondale; Pa.; has been named director of business development; responsible for identifying and securing clients in both the government and commercial business sectors./brAmy McCoy of West Grove Pa.; has been named director of finance. She will also have responsibilities for managing employee benefits and facility operations./brTony Tancredi of Pennsville; N.J.; has been appointed director of technology. He will be responsible for overall strategic technology direction as well as technical pre sales functions.
what happened: Diamond Technologies Inc. appointed Tony Tancredi as Director of Technology
about person: Tony Tancredi was previously the V.P. of Technology at WorldExtend
about company: Diamond Technologies is a high caliber IT Services company that helps organizations achieve strategic business objectives through the implementation of leading information technologies.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: FORM 8 K: DISCOVERY LABORATORIES FILES CURRENT REPORT
Industry: Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech : Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech Other
The full text of the press release: FORM 8 K: DISCOVERY LABORATORIES FILES CURRENT REPORT /br22 September 2010/brUS Fed News/brWASHINGTON; Sept. 22    Discovery Laboratories Inc.; Warrington; Pa.; files Form 8 K (current report) with Securities and Exchange Commission on Sept. 21./brState or other jurisdiction of incorporation: Delaware/brTermination of a Material Definitive Agreement./brOn September 15; 2010; Charles F. Katzer submitted his resignation as Senior Vice President and Chief Technology Officer of Discovery Laboratories; Inc. (the "Company") effective September 24; 2010. As a result; Mr. Katzer's employment agreement with the Company will terminate on that date. providing large scale Real Estate and Infrastructure Project Management Services. /brCentral National–Gottesman has appointed Jim Panos to CIO. Central National specializes in the global sale of pulp; paper; paperboard and newsprint and is located in Purchase; NY./brTelstra has appointed former Seek; Wespac; NAB and Standard Chartered Bank technology executive Patrick Eltridge to be its new CIO; following the resignation of John McInerny in June. Eltridge spent much of his career at the National Australia Bank through the 1990?s; ending up as its head of business and IT alignment; before spending a brief period as a consultant at Boston Consulting Group. /brWoodrow Chin; formerly of a San Francisco based Internet company called Exit13 and Wachovia; joined Dillard's this month as their CIO. Dillard’s; based in Little Rock; Arkansas; is an upscale retailer with over 330 stores in 29 states. Chin replaces former CIO Bill Holder.
what happened: Central National–Gottesman appointed Jim Panos as Chief Information Officer
