title: Vice President of Web Technology
headline: Moore Joins Charter Team
Industry: Telecommunications : Telephone Service Providers and Accessories
The full text of the press release: Moore Joins Charter Team/brIndustry Vet Will Head Online Customer Services Initiatives/brMike Farrell    Multichannel News; 10/25/2010 1:44:19 PM/br/brCharter Communications named industry veteran Marti Moore to the newly created position of vice president; Web Technology   Customer Experience. Her first day was Oct. 25; joining the team led by executive vice president operations and chief technology officer Marwan Fawaz./brMoore has in nearly 20 years experience in the online and media industries; most recently serving as vice president of technology at Media News Group Interactive. Prior to that she held various leadership positions at Level 3 Communications and worked in management and technology roles at Verizon and the United States Air Force./brA growing number of customers are utilizing the web to purchase services; ask questions; resolve service issues; and access news; information and entertainment. Moore; in her new role; will work with each of those functions; leading the planning; strategy and execution of all areas of the online customer experience./brMoore has a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from Drake University in Iowa; and an M.S. in Space Operations from the University of Colorado at Colorado Springs. She is an active member of Women in Cable Telecommunications (WICT) and has served on various committees and boards for the Rocky Mountain Chapter.
what happened: Charter Communications; Inc. appointed Marti Moore as Vice President of Web Technology
about person: Marti Moore was previously the Vice President; Technology at Media News Group.
about company: Charter Communications; Inc. is a leading broadband communications company and the third largest publicly traded cable operator in the United States.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: City's chief information officer becomes first Daley cabinet member to resign
The full text of the press release: City's chief information officer becomes first Daley cabinet member to resign /brComments /brSeptember 30; 2010/br/brBY FRAN SPIELMAN City Hall Reporter /brLet the exodus begin./brHardik Bhatt; Chicago’s chief information officer; has resigned his $141;840 a year job to join Cisco Systems; a California company that bills itself as the “worldwide leader in networking that transforms how people connect; communicate and collaborate.”/brBhatt is the first member of Mayor Daley’s cabinet to pull the plug since the mayor chose political retirement over the quest for a seventh term./brBut he’s not expected to be the last. /brAll 956 city policymakers exempt from the federal Shakman decree banning political hiring and firing must decide whether to stick around — and hope they can defy the odds and be retained by Daley’s successor — or dust off their resumes now./br“There’s a lot of talented people who work for the mayor’s administration who were here; in part; because he recruited them;” said Ald. Pat O’Connor (40th); the mayor’s City Council floor leader. /br“If there’s opportunities for them to go elsewhere; they would be free now to take those opportunities . . . . I think you’ll have people out there looking” for jobs. /brBhatt runs an 80 employee; $19.5 million a year department that operates the “technology infrastructure” underpinning city government. /brHe recently completed a multi million overhaul of the city’s website to make it more user friendly./brBhatt was also a driving force behind efforts to bridge the “digital divide” by using federal economic stimulus money to expand high speed internet access to five needy neighborhoods: Auburn Gresham; Chicago Lawn; Englewood; Humboldt Park and Pilsen./brWith Bhatt’s departure; insiders are joking that the Department of Innovation and Technology or DO IT; as it’s known around City Hall; might have to use the slogan; “Do it yourself.” /brFour months ago; Daley used the city’s new website to get some measure of revenge against the investigative reporters who have made his life miserable by digging up dirt on the Hired Truck; city hiring and minority contracting scandals. /brAt the mayor’s direction; the redesign included a log of all Freedom of Information Act requests. The list includes the name and organization of each applicant; documents demanded and dates the information was requested and is due to be released./brA new state law merely requires city departments to maintain such a log — not to post it on the Internet to tip investigative reporters about the trail being followed by competitors./brBut Daley gleefully declared he was going "above and beyond what's required" in the interest of "transparency; openness and the free flow of information."/br"If you want transparency in government; you have to have this. I'm sorry. This has nothing to do with [getting even with] the Sun Times; Tribune; media or anything. This is what you want;" Daley said then./brBhatt could not be reached for comment.
what happened: Hardik Bhatt resigned as Chief Information Officer of City of Chicago
about person: Hardik Bhatt was previously the chief information officer of the city of Chicago.
about company: Chicago is the largest city in the state of Illinois. With over 2.8 million residents; it is the most populous city in the Midwestern United States and the third most populous city in the country.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Philip Emond Named as CIGNA’s Chief Information Officer
Industry: Financial Services : Insurance and Risk Management
The full text of the press release: September 20; 2010 04:00 PM Eastern Daylight Time /brPhilip Emond Named as CIGNA’s Chief Information Officer /brPHILADELPHIA  (BUSINESS WIRE)  David M. Cordani; president and chief executive officer of CIGNA Corporation (NYSE:CI); today announced the appointment of Philip Emond to the position of executive vice president and Chief Information Officer of CIGNA's U.S. operations; effective October 8; 2010. Emond; currently senior vice president of CIGNA Information Technology; will succeed Michael Woeller; who will retire next month after serving as executive vice president and Chief Information Officer of CIGNA’s U.S. operations since October 2007. /br “For the past three years; Mike has ably led CIGNA's Information Technology Division. During that time; the technology organization has evolved significantly to better meet the changing needs of today’s market; the team has been strengthened; and succession has been proactively planned – part of which included adding Phil to the team in 2008. From the start; Phil has demonstrated a deep understanding of technology innovation in the healthcare industry and has shown strong leadership qualities; passion for our customers and a focus on consistently delivering results;” Cordani said. “In naming Phil to this role; CIGNA will continue to build on the solid foundation Mike has established in partnership with Phil and the entire CIGNA technology team.” /brEmond was appointed senior vice president of CIGNA Corporation in June of 2008. In this role; he was responsible for the delivery of end to end technology solutions in support of CIGNA’s businesses. /brPrior to joining CIGNA; over the course of his 30 year career; Emond held a variety of senior financial services leadership positions; most recently as executive vice president for Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CIBC); with responsibility for CIBC’s technology; retail and investment banking operations worldwide. Before CIBC; he served as Managing Director; Technology; Bankers Trust/Deutsche Bank; and as senior vice president and CIO; ING Canada. In a prior role; Emond also served as Director General and CIO; Citizenship and Immigration Canada. Emond holds a degree in Administration from Carleton University in Ottawa; Canada. /br“Mike came out of retirement to play a pivotal transitional role in refining and executing CIGNA's technology strategy as a global health service company. With that path clearly set; and with the team aligned to deliver; Mike will hand over the leadership reins to Phil and will return to retirement confident in the knowledge he has served the company and our customers very well. CIGNA recognizes and appreciates Mike’s contributions and we wish him a long and happy retirement;” Cordani said. /brAbout CIGNA /brCIGNA (NYSE: CI) is a global health service and financial company dedicated to helping people improve their health; well being and sense of security. CIGNA Corporation's operating subsidiaries in the United States provide an integrated suite of health services; such as medical; dental; behavioral health; pharmacy and vision care benefits; as well as group life; accident and disability insurance. Outside the U.S. CIGNA provides employers; affinity groups and individuals access to quality health care and related financial protection programs. CIGNA offers insurance products in 27 countries and jurisdictions and has approximately 60 million customer relationships throughout the United States and around the world; including expatriates in virtually every country. To learn more about CIGNA; visit www.cigna.com. To sign up for email alerts or an RSS feed of company news; log on to http://newsroom.cigna.com/section_display.cfm?section_id=18 /brContacts /brCIGNA Corporation/brGloria Barone; 215.761.4758 Gloria.barone@cigna.com
what happened: CIGNA Corporation's U.S. operations promoted Philip Emond to Chief Information Officer
about person: Philip Emond was previously the senior vice president of CIGNA Information Technology.
about company: CIGNA (NYSE: CI) is a global health service and financial company dedicated to helping people improve their health; well being and sense of security.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: FORM 8 K: CIGNA FILES CURRENT REPORT
Industry: Financial Services : Insurance and Risk Management
The full text of the press release: FORM 8 K: CIGNA FILES CURRENT REPORT /br21 September 2010/brUS Fed News/brWASHINGTON; Sept. 21    CIGNA Corp.; Philadelphia; files Form 8 K (current report) with Securities and Exchange Commission on Sept. 20./brState or other jurisdiction of incorporation: Delaware/brDeparture of Directors or Principal Officers; Election of Directors; Appointment of Certain Officers; Compensatory Arrangements of Certain Officers./brOn September 20; 2010; the Company announced that Michael Woeller; Executive Vice President and Chief Information Officer of CIGNA Corporation's U.S. operations and one of our named executive officers; is retiring from the Company effective October 8; 2010./brThe Company entered into a retirement agreement with Mr. Woeller; dated as of September 20; 2010. Mr. Woeller's agreement includes customary confidentiality; non solicitation; non competition; non disparagement and release provisions. In addition; the agreement provides for benefits consisting of: (1) a payout under his annual management incentive arrangement; and (2) payouts under his long term incentive arrangement; consisting of payments of his Strategic Performance Units (SPU) for the 2008 2010 performance period and a cash payment for restricted stock units he was previously granted; which will be valued based upon the price of CIGNA's common stock on December 30; 2010. The estimated aggregate value of these benefits is approximately $2.3 million. This estimate is based upon a target SPU value of $75 per unit; which is used in the 2010 proxy statement; his 2010 management incentive target and a per unit price for restricted stock units of $35.07; which represents the price of a share of CIGNA common stock on September 14; 2010. The actual payment and timing of the SPU award will be determined by the People Resources Committee in accordance with the terms of the CIGNA Long Term Incentive Plan. A copy of Mr. Woeller's separation agreement is attached hereto as Exhibit 10.1; and the description of that agreement contained herein is qualified in its entirety by reference to the attached document.
what happened: Michael Woeller retired as Chief Information Officer of CIGNA Corporation's U.S. operations
about person: Michael Woeller was previously the Vice Chairman and CIO at CIBC
about company: CIGNA (NYSE: CI) is a global health service and financial company dedicated to helping people improve their health; well being and sense of security.

title: Director of Technology
headline: End Of An Era – Goodbye Jordan!
Industry: Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech : Doctors and Health Care Practiotioners
The full text of the press release: End Of An Era – Goodbye Jordan!/brLast Friday marked the end of an era at CMS as Jordan Halasz; CMS’ Director of Technology; officially retired after 17 years at CMS and over 30 years within the MGH system. As many of you know; Jordan has been at CMS since it’s beginning. He will truly be missed. However; CMS’ loss is going to be the University of Miami’s gain. Starting in November Jordan will become their Nursing School’s Director of Simulation Services. This is a wonderful opportunity for Jordan. Not only will he have the opportunity to help build a new simulation center; he’ll be able to indulge in his lifelong passion; golf; on a regular basis. Everyone here at CMS wishes Jordan and his wife; Maxine; all the best! Click on this link to our facebook page at www.facebook.com/medicalsimulation to see pictures of our farewell dinner for Jordan where many of his Boston area simulation friends celebrated Jordan and all he meant to us.
what happened: Jordan Halasz retired as Director of Technology of Center for Medical Simulation
about person: Jordan Halasz has been at CMS since it’s founding in various leadership roles.
about company: CMS focuses on communication; collaboration; and crisis management to develop skills and teamwork behaviors that are best learned actively under realistic conditions.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: LEAVING A GIANT AGENCY FOR A BOUTIQUE BUSINESS
The full text of the press release: 17 Sep 2010/brLeaving a Giant Agency for a Boutique Business /br/brRosemarie Ryan and Ty Montague; third from left; founded the agency Co: and are operating it with Neil Parker; left; and Richard Schatzberger. Ms. Ryan and Mr. Montague were formerly executives at JWT./brCo:; with a colon; is the name of an agency being opened in New York by Ty Montague and Rosemarie Ryan; who surprised Madison Avenue in March by disclosing that they would leave their senior posts at the giant JWT for an entrepreneurial venture. The name — perhaps one of the pithiest for any agency — is meant to suggest the Co: business model by evoking words like co creation; collaboration and co venturing./br/brFittingly; Mr. Montague and Ms. Ryan had been co presidents of the North American operations of JWT; part of WPP; she arrived at the agency in 2004 and he joined a year later. Mr. Montague had also been chief creative officer for North America. They joined a lengthy list of top executives of large agencies who have recently left to open their own shops; take ownership stakes in smaller agencies or; in some instances; quit advertising./br/br“We’re in a period of great change in the business;” Mr. Montague said in an interview. He and Ms. Ryan; who are both 47; are “in a period of our lives to do our own things;” he said./br/brMs. Ryan; who joined Mr. Montague for the interview; chimed in; “Or never do our own things.” (They frequently finished each other’s sentences during a 30 minute chat; discussing their plans with a reporter for the first time since they left JWT.)/br/br•/br/brThe pair said they knew the world was not waiting for another agency; but one with a nontraditional approach may be welcomed by marketers looking for different approaches to solving problems and selling products./br/brMr. Montague and Ms. Ryan; whose titles at Co: are co founders; described the agency as a “brand studio;” likening it to a movie studio that provides money and infrastructure to a continually changing lineup of actors; writers; directors and producers./br/brAt Co:; “teams are formed around individual client needs;” Mr. Montague said; “and when the needs are satisfied; the teams are dispersed.”/br/brTo form those teams; Co: will draw from a list of “co conspirators” — 40 agencies; consultancies and firms that specialize in tasks like media services; digital and interactive marketing; public relations; social media; design; brand identity; event marketing; technology; ideation and gaming./br/br“It’s forming relationships with specialist experts;” Mr. Montague said; or; he added; laughing; “coalitions of the willing.”/br/brThose potential collaborators — a mix of established and fledgling agencies — include Big Spaceship; Blue State Digital; Campfire; Collins; Consigliere; Creative Feed; DKC Public Relations and Integrated Marketing; Horizon Media; MediaLink; Naked Communications; Powell Communications; Propellerfish; Red Bricks Media; Vast Ventures and Victors & Spoils./br/br“Ty and I have always been looking for something to work on together;” said Brian Collins; chief creative officer at Collins in New York; which works on design; brand experiences and brand strategy./br/brMr. Collins compared how he will work with Co: to when he led the Brand Innovation Group at Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide and collaborated with agencies like AKQA and Wieden & Kennedy on assignments for clients like Coca Cola. Co: is opening with four clients; two of which Mr. Montague and Ms. Ryan named: Madison Square Garden; for the New York Knicks; and MTV Networks; for the Spike cable channel. The others are a “luxury conglomerate” and a consultancy; Ms. Ryan said./br/brHoward Jacobs; senior vice president for marketing and ticket sales at the MSG Sports unit of Madison Square Garden; said he was attracted to Co: because the task he confronts — “how do you reignite the deeply passionate relationship that existed between the City of New York and the Knicks?” — is “so clearly not an ‘advertising exercise’ ” but rather requires “a multidisciplinary approach; part strategy; part storytelling; part brand creation; part technology; part design.”/br/br•/br/br“We’re going to access the various resources Co: offers and throw some of our own in there;” Mr. Jacobs said; to determine “what is the future of fan engagement” with the team./br/brCo: is also interested in generating revenue through investing in or starting businesses; which agencies like Anomaly and Bartle Bogle Hegarty also do in addition to marketing work. That explains the presence of Vast Ventures on the list of collaborators./br/br“I’m an adviser to Ty and Rosemarie and plan to be a ‘co conspirator;’ looking at opportunities with them to potentially invest in;” said Doug Chertok; chief executive at Vast Ventures in New York./br/br“And I plan to invest in Co:;” he added./br/brCo: is opening with two senior executives in addition to Mr. Montague and Ms. Ryan. They are Neil Parker; 45; chief strategy officer; who was most recently global head of strategy at Wolff Olins; part of the Omnicom Group; and Richard Schatzberger; 33; chief technology officer; who was most recently director for creative technology at Bartle Bogle Hegarty./br/brThere are plans to hire a fifth senior executive; Ms. Ryan said; a chief commercial officer who would “help us run the co venture side.”/br/brMr. Montague said the pair “had a great run at JWT;” but “it just felt it was time” to “cast our lot outside” the realm of worldwide agency networks./br/brAs for being entrepreneurial in this economy; tough times often bring on “a period of innovation;” he added./br/br“Starting a business is energizing; exciting and a little bit scary;” Mr. Montague said. “When you wake up every day; you don’t quite know what’s going to happen next.”
what happened: Richard Schatzberger; joined co: as the chief technology officer.
about person: Richard Schatzberger was most recently director for creative technology at Bartle Bogle Hegarty.
about company: co: is a brand studio for the 21st century CEO and CMO.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Colonial Consulting Announces the Addition of Joseph Fung as Chief Technology Officer
The full text of the press release: Colonial Consulting Announces the Addition of Joseph Fung as Chief Technology Officer /br27 September 2010/brMarketwire/brColonial Consulting CTO to Help Advance Firm's Business Initiatives Through Technology/brNEW YORK; NY    (MARKET WIRE)    Sep 27; 2010    Colonial Consulting; LLC; a leading investment advisor with a core focus on not for profits; is pleased to announce that Joseph Fung has joined the firm as chief technology officer. will allow him to help the organization stay ahead of an ever changing marketplace; effectively manage our data; information and technology strategy; and lead our critical transparency programs;" said Richard Ketchum; Chairman and CEO of FINRA./brGaer will start at FINRA on November 1 and report directly to Ketchum. Gaer is the founder of Tragara Alpha Partners LLC. Prior to Tragara; he spent five years at NYMEX Holdings; Inc.; as CIO and executive vice president. There; he was responsible for global operations; including technology infrastructure; and played a leadership role in organizing the merger between NYMEX and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. Gaer also spent a year as CEO of NYMEX Europe./brIn addition to managing FINRA's data; information and technology strategy; Gaer will oversee TRACE; FINRA's corporate bond transaction reporting system./brFINRA is the largest non governmental regulator for all securities firms doing business in the United States. FINRA is dedicated to investor protection and market integrity through effective and efficient regulation and complementary compliance and technology based services. FINRA touches virtually every aspect of the securities business – from registering and educating all industry participants to examining securities firms; writing and enforcing rules and the federal securities laws; informing and educating the investing public; providing trade reporting and other industry utilities; and administering the largest dispute resolution forum for investors and registered firms. For more information; please visit www.finra.org.
what happened: Financial Industry Regulatory Authority appointed Samuel Gaer as Chief Information Officer
about person: Samuel Gaer was perviously the President of Tragara Alpha Partners and formerly Chief Information Officer (CIO) of NYMEX Holdings.
about company: FINRA is the largest non governmental regulator for all securities firms doing business in the United States. FINRA is dedicated to investor protection and market integrity through effective and efficient regulation and complementary compliance and technology based services.

title: Head of Information Technology
headline: First New York Securities Names Jean Hill Head of Information Technology
The full text of the press release: October 12; 2010 11:25 AM Eastern Daylight Time /brFirst New York Securities Names Jean Hill Head of Information Technology /brNEW YORK  (BUSINESS WIRE)  First New York Securities; a global multi strategy trading firm; announced today that Jean Hill has been appointed Head of Information Technology. As First New York continues to expand across various asset classes and business lines; including domestic and international equities; macro rates; foreign exchange; commodities; fixed income; derivatives and tax exempt bonds; Ms. Hill will be responsible for further developing and managing the firm’s IT infrastructure. /br“The firm has positioned itself for significant growth in the coming years and I look forward to helping them develop a robust technology infrastructure that complements the firm’s business goals and strategies.”/brMs. Hill brings over 25 years of operations and leadership experience with a focus on implementing business driven strategic IT plans. She has extensive experience in creating managed service models designed to optimize performance and provide incremental business value. /br“Technology is paramount to compete in the global marketplace and we’re committed to building a world class technology platform;” commented Joseph Schenk; CEO of First New York Securities. “Jean’s impressive background and skill set will ensure our technology operations are among the best in the industry.” /br“I am excited to be part of the First New York team;” added Ms. Hill. “The firm has positioned itself for significant growth in the coming years and I look forward to helping them develop a robust technology infrastructure that complements the firm’s business goals and strategies.” /brMs. Hill joins First New York Securities from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York where she was Vice President and Deputy Chief Technology Officer responsible for technology infrastructure services including data centers; networking; desktop and midrange computing environments. Previously she was a Managing Director at Morgan Stanley and was responsible for leading both their Global Wealth and Institutional Technology Services organizations. Her global team at Morgan Stanley consisted of more than 1300 staffers in 30 countries. Prior to Morgan Stanley; she was a Director of IT at Merrill Lynch where she supported the capital markets business. She has a BS from Cornell University and a JD from Fordham University. /brAbout First New York /brFirst New York Securities is a global multi strategy trading firm and registered broker dealer. The firm’s diverse trading business spans numerous asset classes; including domestic and international equities; fixed income; commodities; interest rates; foreign exchange; derivatives; energy and tax exempt bonds. Founded in 1986; First New York is one of the few remaining classic partnerships on Wall Street. A leading technology platform and robust operating infrastructure combined with risk management and diversification strategies serve as the cornerstones of the firm’s continued success. Headquartered in New York City; with European operations based in London; the firm has more than 300 employees globally. To learn more about First New York Securities visit www.FirstNY.com.
what happened: First New York Securities; LLC appointed Jean Hill as Head of Information Technology
about person: Jean Hill brings over 25 years of operations and leadership experience with a focus on implementing business driven strategic IT plans. She has extensive experience in creating managed service models designed to optimize performance and provide incremental business value.
about company: First New York Securities is a global multi strategy trading firm and registered broker dealer. The firm’s diverse trading business spans numerous asset classes; including domestic and international equities; fixed income; commodities; interest rates; foreign exchange; derivatives; energy and tax exempt bonds.

title: Senior Director of Information Technology Services
headline: Neil McElroy and John O’Keefe Take on New Roles to Strengthen ITS
The full text of the press release: News/brOCTOBER 29; 2010/br/brNeil McElroy and John O’Keefe Take on New Roles to Strengthen ITS/brposted in FACULTY AND STAFF; NEWS AND FEATURES; PRESIDENTIAL NEWS/br/brNeil J. McElroy; dean of libraries and information technology services; will take on an additional role as special assistant to President Daniel H. Weiss for information technology strategies./br/brJohn O’Keefe; director of academic technology and network services; has been named senior director of information technology services. He will now oversee administrative information systems as well as academic technology and network services./br/brWeiss and Wendy L. Hill; provost and dean of the faculty; announced the changes in a message to the campus community Oct. 28./br/br“The alignment of the College’s senior information technology officer; Neil McElroy; with the President’s Office reflects our view of the strategic importance of information technology for the future of the College; and the new structure for our information technology operations will enable a more integrated approach to the management of IT campus wide;” they wrote. O’Keefe will continue to report to McElroy. The changes are effective immediately./br/brO’Keefe has served as director of academic technology and network services since 2005. He has played a principal role in reshaping the IT organization following its merger with the library; providing strategic vision and direction for desktop support; help desk; networking infrastructure; servers and systems; application development; and Instructional Technology. Among other significant accomplishments; he played a key role in planning an overhaul of the campus network infrastructure; managing a team of network engineers and consultants through the project’s design and implementation stages. More recently; he led the joint ITS/Communications Division team responsible for transformation of the College’s web site./br/brA 1996 Lafayette graduate; O’Keefe joined the College as an instructional technologist in 2001. He was promoted to manager of instructional technology in 2003./br/brMcElroy has served as dean of libraries and information technology services since 2007. He joined the College as director of libraries in 1990. He became director of libraries and academic information resources in 1997 and served in that role until 2005; when he became director of libraries and information technology services./br/brLafayette at a Glance/brThe History of Lafayette College/brWelcome from Lafayette’s President/brNews/brInitiatives/brAnnouncements/brElectronic Newsletters/brProfiles/brFEATURED EVENTS/br/brOct 30/brCross Country Patriot League Championship/brat 11:00AM; EASTON; PA./br/brOct 30/brFall Fest/brat 1:00PM; THE QUAD/br/brOct 30/brMen's Soccer vs. Bucknell/brat 3:00PM; EASTON; PA./br/brOct 30/brWomen's Soccer vs. Lehigh/brat 7:00PM; EASTON; PA./br/brNEWS AND FEATURES/br/br/brOCTOBER 30; 2010/br/brReligious sacrifices gone wrong. Fraternity secrets. Murder!/brby BLOCKD/br/brOCTOBER 29; 2010/br/brFormer Board Chair Walter E. Hanson ’49 dies at 84/brby DANIELSS/brOCTOBER 29; 2010/br/brNeil McElroy and John O’Keefe Take on New Roles to Strengthen ITS/brby DANIELSS/br/brOCTOBER 29; 2010/br/brStudents Use $10;000 Projects for Peace Grant to Run Summer Youth Program in Colombia/brby LITZENBM/brNATIONAL SURVEY OF /brSTUDENT ENGAGEMENT/br/brResults from NSSE can provide prospective students with insights into how they might learn and develop at a given college. /brLearn more/br/brThe University and College Accountability Network delivers key college information directly to you./br/brVisit the UCAN web site/brYOU
what happened: Lafayette College promoted John O'Keefe to Senior Director of Information Technology Services
about person: John O’Keefe has served as director of academic technology and network services since 2005. He has played a principal role in reshaping the IT organization following its merger with the library; providing strategic vision and direction for desktop support; help desk; networking infrastructure; servers and systems; application development; and Instructional Technology.
about company: For more than 175 years; Lafayette has been known for a spirit of exploration that ignores boundaries; where faculty work with students across disciplines to tackle challenges and solve problems. The ability to make connections and think critically is paramount—on campus; off campus and after graduation.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Hudson Valley Community College Names New Chief Information Office
The full text of the press release: 09/15/2010 /brHudson Valley Community College Names New Chief Information Officer /brCONTACT: Eric Bryant (518) 629 8072; e.bryant@hvcc.edu/brFOR RELEASE: Immediate; Wednesday; Sept. 15; 2010/brDr. Shihong “Steve” Chen recently was named chief information officer at Hudson Valley Community College. /brAs the college’s CIO; Dr. Chen will direct the implementation and usage of all academic and administrative computing at Hudson Valley; the largest undergraduate institution in the Capital Region. The college’s Computer Services Department; which Chen oversees; installs and maintains computer classrooms and network systems at the college’s main campus and at numerous off campus locations; including TEC SMART in Malta; the college’s Albany Extension Center and at 10 high schools where the college offers classes around the Capital Region./brPrior to accepting the position at Hudson Valley; Dr. Chen served as the chief information officer for The University of Texas at Brownsville/Texas Southmost College; the vice president of information technology/special advisor to the president at South Texas College of Law; chief information technology officer/assistant vice president for academic affairs at Utica College of Syracuse University; the college wide director of the Computer and Educational Technology Division of The City College; The City University of New York; and the academic systems manager at Purdue University North Central Campus. /brHe comes to Hudson Valley with a wealth of technical knowledge and experience in the areas of information technology; strategic planning and assessment; information security; disaster recovery and distance education. He was honored and recognized as Senior Fulbright Specialist (2003 2008) in the information technology arena. /brDr. Chen received his doctoral and master's degrees from the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign and his bachelor's degree from Fujian Teachers University in Fuzhou; China. /brFounded in 1953; Hudson Valley Community College offers more than 70 degree and certificate programs in four schools: Business; Engineering and Industrial Technologies; Health Science; and Liberal Arts and Sciences; and an Educational Opportunity Center for academic and career training. One of 30 community colleges in the State University of New York system; it has an enrollment of more than 13;000 students; and is known as a leader in distance learning initiatives and workforce training. Hudson Valley has more than 65;000 alumni.
what happened: Hudson Valley Community College appointed Shihong Chen as Chief Information Officer
about person: Shihong Chen was previously the chief information officer for The University of Texas at Brownsville/Texas Southmost College.
about company: Founded in 1953; Hudson Valley Community College offers more than 70 degree and certificate programs in four schools: Business; Engineering and Industrial Technologies; Health Science; and Liberal Arts and Sciences; and an Educational Opportunity Center for academic and career training.

title: Executive Vice President of Software and Technology
headline: Conservation Services Group hires Dieter as executive VP
The full text of the press release: Conservation Services Group hires Dieter as executive VP/brConservation Services Group (CSG) recently announced the appointment of Michael J. Dieter as executive vice president of software and technology. In this new position; Dieter will oversee CSG's expanding information technology division and the development of a new information systems vision for the national energy services firm. Dieter is a member of CSG's executive committee and will work out of the company's corporate headquarters in Westborough. Throughout his career; he has held several chief technology officer (CTO) positions. His CTO experience includes seven years at Homedirect USA; where he served on the executive staff of that supply chain company.
what happened: Conservation Services Group (CSG) recently announced the appointment of Michael J. Dieter as executive vice president of software and technology.
about person: Michael J. Dieter has held several chief technology officer (CTO) positions. His CTO experience includes seven years at Homedirect USA; where he served on the executive staff of that supply chain company.
about company: Founded in 1984; CSG provides energy savings strategies; program design; management services/brand technologies to utilities; government agencies; energy services companies; public housing/brauthorities and other groups.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: 2Checkout.com’s Mark Bishopp Named CIO and SVP Strategy
Industry: Software & Internet : E commerce and Internet Businesses
The full text of the press release: September 15; 2010 01:24 PM Eastern Daylight Time /br2Checkout.com’s Mark Bishopp Named CIO and SVP Strategy /brCOLUMBUS; Ohio  (BUSINESS WIRE)  2Checkout.com; Inc.; a leading global online payment solutions provider; is pleased to announce the promotion of Mark Bishopp to Chief Information Officer and Senior Vice President of Strategic Development. In this role Mark will be responsible for all technology; strategic relationships; business plan/analysis and contract negotiations for the organization. /br“This change in position will allow Mark to align his skills; interests; and experience to make sure 2Checkout continues to grow in ways that add value to the brand as well as our clients.”/brWith more than 22+ years of progressive international executive experience in interim CIO roles; strategic planning/alignment management; contract negotiation and critical program execution; Mark brings a powerful perspective to how businesses can strategically plan for and implement new and existing technologies. Because of his extensive background; Mark is the perfect fit to direct 2Checkout’s ongoing strategy and technology initiatives. /brTom Dailey; President of 2Checkout.com; stated; “This change in position will allow Mark to align his skills; interests; and experience to make sure 2Checkout continues to grow in ways that add value to the brand as well as our clients.” /brMark holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration from St. Bonaventure University in New York. /brAbout 2Checkout.com; Inc. /brFounded in 2000 and based in Columbus; Ohio; 2Checkout.com; Inc. is a global payments solutions provider servicing approximately 60;000 online retailers. 2Checkout provides web based businesses a merchant account alternative and a fully automated suite of backend services; including world class fraud protection; customer care; PCI data storage; and multiple payment methods in multiple currencies and languages. For more information visit http://www.2checkout.com. /brContacts /br2Checkout.com; Inc./brBill Clifford; 614 921 2450 wclifford@2co.com

The full text of the press release: Tuesday; September 14; 2010 /brLynguent Names CEO/brPortland based Lynguent; a provider of software simulation tools for analog and mixed signal semiconductors; said today that it has named Sam Young as its new President and CEO. Young joins the firm from Contour Semiconductor. Founder and former CEO Martin Vlach has become Chief Technology Officer for the firm. Lynguent said Young also has participated in the raise of $100 million in venture capital for companies; and has previously been at IDL; Hynix Semiconductor; Exel Microelectronics; Corsair Microsystems and Hyundai Electronics' Flash memory division; among other firms.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Vikhyath Kodipelli Named as Benaissance CTO
The full text of the press release: http://www.benaissance.com//brOctober 19; 2010 06:00 AM Eastern Daylight Time /brVikhyath Kodipelli Named as Benaissance CTO/br/brOMAHA; Neb.  (BUSINESS WIRE)  Benaissance today announced that it has promoted Mr. Vikhyath Kodipelli to Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Mr. Kodipelli will assume CTO responsibilities immediately. As CTO; Mr. Kodipelli will be responsible for developing and executing Benaissance’s technical strategy and leading its technology and quality assurance teams to meet the rapid growth of the company. This includes ensuring COBRApoint continues to deliver a world class end user experience for our customers and their clients and members. In addition; Mr. Kodipelli will drive the continued innovation of Benaissance’s Software as a Service (SaaS) technology platforms./br/br “I am extremely pleased to name Vik as Benaissance’s CTO. Vik has been with Benaissance for two years as a Senior .NET Developer and during this time has repeatedly proven his exceptional technical knowledge; managerial talents and superb understanding of the mission critical needs of our customers”/br/br“I am extremely pleased to name Vik as Benaissance’s CTO. Vik has been with Benaissance for two years as a Senior .NET Developer and during this time has repeatedly proven his exceptional technical knowledge; managerial talents and superb understanding of the mission critical needs of our customers;” said John Jenkins; CEO at Benaissance. “I am personally excited to have the opportunity to work closely with Vik as we continue in our mission of building the most robust; flexible and secure SaaS solutions for the COBRA and non COBRA administration services industry.”/br/brMr. Kodipelli brings to Benaissance deep technical experience and professional certifications including Microsoft Certified Application Developer (MCAD) and Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer (MCSD). Additionally; Mr. Kodipelli received his M.S. in Management Information Systems from the University of Nebraska at Omaha’s Peter Kiewit Institute and his MBA in Finance from Osmania University in India. Additionally; Mr. Kodipelli is a graduate of the National Institute of Information Technology (NIIT) in India. Mr. Kodipelli is married with one child./br/brAbout Benaissance/brFounded in 2003; Benaissance has grown into a leader in “Software as a Service” solutions for COBRA and non COBRA administrators across the nation. COBRApoint; Benaissance’s flagship solution is supported by business process outsourcing services which currently include Payment Services and Mail Services. McCarthy Capital partnered with Benaissance in 2008 to support management’s plan for growth and expansion into the payor and administrator markets/br/brAbout McCarthy Capital/brBased in Omaha; NE with offices in Denver and Boston; McCarthy Capital manages $500 million in private equity assets and capital commitments. Please visit www.mccarthycapital.com./br/brFor more information: www.benaissance.com/brContact: sales@benaissance.com/brPhone: 887 884 7021/brContacts/br/brBenaissance/brJohn B. Jenkins; 877 884 7021/brPresident & CEO/brwww.benaissance.com/brjohn.jenkins@benaissance.com/brPermalink: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20101019005263/en/Vikhyath Kodipelli Named Benaissance CTO

headline: FSV Payment Systems Names Seasoned Payment Expert Steve Fussell President
The full text of the press release: October 21; 2010 10:41 AM Eastern Daylight Time /brFSV Payment Systems Names Seasoned Payment Expert Steve Fussell President /brHOUSTON  (BUSINESS WIRE)  FSV Payment Systems; Inc.; a leading provider of network branded prepaid debit card products and processing services; today announced Steve Fussell has joined FSV in the newly created role of President. /br“This is a great time to be in prepaid; especially with a leading prepaid provider like FSV”/br“I am delighted to have Steve join FSV. Steve has a broad skill set and a track record of success in all of the companies he has helped grow. His knowledge and vision of how to employ technology as a differentiator will be crucial to taking FSV to the next level;” said Rick Savard; FSV’s chief executive officer. /br“This is a great time to be in prepaid; especially with a leading prepaid provider like FSV;” commented Fussell. “Rather than struggling to find opportunities; for FSV; it’s a matter of striking the right balance among our processing; employer solutions and retail businesses and pursuing the most efficient path for long term; sustainable growth. That’s a challenge I look forward to.” /brMost recently; Fussell served as CIO responsible for NewComLink’s strategic and information technology initiatives. Previously; he was CIO/COO at NetSpend Corporation; leading their technology; information systems; security and operational areas of the business. Before that; Steve spent over 17 years at Macy’s (previously Federated Department Stores) in various positions; including Software Engineer; General Manager; Director; Security Officer and as a Vice President. /brAbout FSV Payment Systems /brFSV Payment Systems is a leader in the delivery of prepaid debit program management and processing services. Founded in 1999; the privately held company successfully delivers processing and prepaid card programs for payroll; rebates; loyalty and promotions and general purpose reloadable cards for retail; gift and healthcare. FSV is headquartered in Houston; Texas; and operates a state of the art client and cardholder service center in Jacksonville; Fla. For more information; visit www.fsvps.com. /brPhotos/Multimedia Gallery Available: http://www.businesswire.com/cgi bin/mmg.cgi?eid=6477879&lang=en

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Weakness in Canada's venture capital system at `crisis levels'
The full text of the press release: Weakness in Canada's venture capital system at `crisis levels'./brBy Bert Hill; Postmedia News October 8; 2010 /brOTTAWA   For technology startups; the opportunity to make their pitches to potential investors at venues such as the recent Ontario Venture Capital Forum is more than welcome./brBut few expect the climate of scarcity to change quickly. Instead; they hope to make contacts that could eventually lead to cash./br"It is very different market from 2000;" said Alexander Rink; chief executive officer of Gazaro; an electronic products online pricing comparison service./br"Investors are looking companies with commercial products on the path to growth. If we were a pure development company looking for money; it would be very difficult."/brJay Lawrence; chief executive officer of PatientWay; which has sold patient access software to hospitals in Kemptville and in western Ontario; said he wants to make contacts and raise the profile of his startup./br"We are being very pragmatic about the situation. We will do our show and tell about our product and progress; but if we get financing immediately I will be surprised."/brInstead; the two companies are relying on early seed investors; consulting contracts and past success with other products to finance growth./brDeloitte; the consulting company; recently sounded a strong warning as it celebrated the success of the latest crop of 50 fast growing new Canadian technology companies including several in Ottawa./brDeloitte spokesman Duncan Stewart noted that just 30 per cent of the group are public companies rather than 54 per cent a decade ago; "reflecting a difficult time for IPOs and the ongoing venture capital crisis."/brA Deloitte survey of technology CEOs shows "Canadian based venture capital firms are in danger of becoming an irrelevant source of financing for the country's companies and 83 per cent see this development as jeopardizing future generations of technology companies in Canada."/brThe survey found that 76 per cent of newer companies rely on internal cash flow to drive operations while angel (early stage) and VC funding was ranked as less than half as important./br"Although this year's winning companies are doing incredibly well;'' said John Ruffolo; another Deloite executive; "who knows how much bigger they would be today if they had had access to more growth capital in their formative years?/br"This persistent weakness in the country's venture capital ecosystem has now reached crisis levels and it has serious implications for the future of our technology sector and the future of Canada;'' he said./brSixteen companies will strut their stuff at the Ontario Venture Summit including seven from Ottawa and Eastern Ontario and eight from Waterloo. It replaces the former Ottawa Venture Capital Fair; later the venture and technology summit; which ran for 13 years./brThe Ottawa Centre for Research and Innovation said the event is important; generating $11 million for Ottawa companies last year./brThe scarcity of venture capital could be leading to unusual behaviour: Some companies are getting new cash but they aren't talking about it for fear it will just attract more hungry mouths./brIn the June quarter; local companies raised $35 million according to the Venture Capital Association but only $12.5 million was announced; by Energate and by Sidense./brMost of the money went to companies that had won earlier rounds of funding. New companies continued to starve except for one communications and networking startup that landed $10.7 million; the biggest single funding of the quarter./brThe Ottawa and Canadian venture industry is recovering; but at a much slower pace than around the world. Much publicized changes to Canadian tax rules have yet to generate benefits./brHopefully; Ottawa can still turn the page and avoid more setbacks like the closing of once promising startups like Liquid Computing and fire sales of Kleer and Neterion./brThe Ottawa participants include some companies that have received public attention like eSight; which is developing technology for people with seeing impairment; Chinook Mobile Heating and Deicing aimed at airports; YouiLabs; which makes a graphics software processor and Protecode; which helps manage open source software./brIt also features relative unknowns like Zeebu; which makes a child's education game application for BlackBerry and Sparq Systems of Kingston; which makes a power converter for solar panels./brGazaro and Patientway are carefully managing resources as they search for market openings./brGazaro's Alexander Rink said that sales have risen 500 per cent and the number of users of its e commerce site have risen 60 per cent in the last four months./brThe service lets people in the hunt for electronics know where the deals are; relying on software that mines databases for instant price movements and comparing them in deal score./brBoth companies have about 10 employees with plans to hire more./brGazaro is supported by Apption Software which is developing artificial intelligence and service oriented software for the public and private sector and helped support Gazaro's real time software offering./brRink counts Inforetrieval and Publivage among the startups he developed./brSam Zaid; the founding Gazaro CEO; is now the chief technology officer./brPatientway was spawned by Infonium; a company that helped the Ontario government build a spending accountability standard for hospitals./brThat experience led to a new company aimed at aimed at easing the cost and frustration of getting patients in front of doctors./brLawrence said the Patientway technology is being implemented at Kemptville District Hospital; the Stronach Cancer Centre in Newmarket and Grey Bruce Health Services in Owen Sound./brBy speeding the flow of information between doctors' offices scheduling hospital tests; he said hospitals can reduce clerical loads by 30 per cent./brPatients can swipe special cards in hospital kiosks; reducing the traditional eight to 10 minute registration wait to 30 seconds./brBut hospitals are slow to adopt new technology with taxpayers and opposition parties vigilant for any seeming evidence of waste. He said the company is financing growth with help from government research tax credits and marketing assistance from OCRI./brLawrence said his company has priced its first customers deals at attractive rates in the hopes of coaxing more profitable business from the 30 other hospitals it is courting.
what happened: Gazaro promoted Sam Zaid to Chief Technology Officer
about person: Sam Zaid was previously the CEO of Gazaro.
about company: Gazaro tracks prices on electronics products in near real time from online and brick & mortar retailers using a patent pending artificial intelligence system to identify the best buying opportunities.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Government Employees Insurance Company Names Kalinsky SVP and CIO
Industry: Financial Services : Insurance and Risk Management
The full text of the press release: September 16; 2010 11:13 AM Eastern Daylight Time /brGEICO names Greg Kalinsky senior vice president and CIO/br/brOther corporate moves announced/br/brWASHINGTON  (BUSINESS WIRE)  Greg Kalinsky began his new assignment as GEICO’s senior vice president and CIO with responsibilities for the company’s information technology operations on Monday; Sept. 13./br/brPreviously Kalinsky served as vice president of GEICO’s West Coast operations at the company’s San Diego regional office./br/brKalinsky began his career at GEICO in 1985 as a sorter in the mailroom while he was completing his undergraduate degree at George Mason University./br/brDuring the course of his GEICO career; he has taken on management assignments in key areas of the company including sales; service and product management. At one time he headed underwriting activities for the company’s regional office in Fredericksburg; Va.; and went on to serve as vice president for the corporate underwriting department./br/brKalinsky earned his J.D. degree from the George Mason University School of Law in 2000; and also served in GEICO’s general counsel’s office./br/brAlso taking on new GEICO assignments:/br/brScott Markel was elected vice president and will manage the Midwest operations in Macon; Ga.; responsible for eight Midwestern states. Markel previously served as assistant vice president of underwriting for GEICO’s Midwest profit center since 2005./br/brDan Beacom was elected assistant vice president and will manage claims in GEICO’s Dallas regional office. Beacom previously served as director of auto damage and liability claims in the San Diego regional office./br/brShawn Burklin; vice president; will manage the company’s San Diego regional office; responsible for CA; AK and HI./br/brMary Zarcone; vice president; will head GEICO’s Southeast operations in Macon; Ga.; responsible for seven southeastern states./br/brRick Hoagland; assistant vice president; will head underwriting activities for GEICO’s Midwest profit center in Macon; Ga./br/brSuzanne Worthen; assistant vice president; will be in charge of the Midwest profit center’s claims operation in Macon; Ga./br/brGEICO (Government Employees Insurance Company) is a member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies and is the third largest private passenger auto insurer in the United States. GEICO provides auto insurance coverage for 9 million policyholders and insures more than 16 million vehicles./br/brIn addition to auto insurance; GEICO offers customers insurance products for their motorcycles; all terrain vehicles (ATVs); and mobile homes. Coverage for life; boats; homes and apartments is available through the GEICO Insurance Agency. Commercial auto insurance and personal umbrella protection are also available./br/brAs a member of the Berkshire Hathaway group of companies; GEICO is rated A++ for financial strength by A.M. Best Company and ranks at the top of several national customer satisfaction surveys. For more information; go to http://www.geico.com.
what happened: Government Employees Insurance Company promoted Greg Kalinsky to Chief Information Officer
about person: Greg Kalinsky was previously the vice president of GEICO's West Coast operations at the company's San Diego regional office.

GEICO provides auto insurance coverage for more than 9 million policyholders and insures more than 16 million vehicles.

title: Vice President of Information Technology
headline: Glatfelter names Janis Jesse as vice president of IT
The full text of the press release: September 20; 2010 05:09 PM Eastern Daylight Time /brGlatfelter Appoints Janis Jesse as Vice President Information Technology /brYORK; Pa.  (BUSINESS WIRE)  Glatfelter (NYSE: GLT) today announced the appointment of Janis Jesse as Vice President Information Technology (IT); effective September 20; 2010. In this role; Janis will have overall responsibility for the global IT organization and will report to John Jacunski; Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. She will play a key role on Glatfelter’s Senior Executive Team with responsibility for leading global IT operations and aligning IT strategy and resources with critical business objectives. /br“Information technology at Glatfelter plays an increasingly important role as we continue to expand our business on a global scale. Janis has developed a proven track record of hands on execution; building strong partnerships and developing IT strategy to improve business performance.”/brIn making this announcement; Mr. Jacunski commented; “Information technology at Glatfelter plays an increasingly important role as we continue to expand our business on a global scale. Janis has developed a proven track record of hands on execution; building strong partnerships and developing IT strategy to improve business performance.” /brJanis brings over 30 years of global experience in senior leadership and program management roles within diverse; growing businesses. Janis had corporate responsibility at International Paper Corporation (IP) for IT strategy development; enterprise architecture; IT investment and governance; and project management processes. Prior thereto; Janis was a Business CIO at IP with responsibility for two major business sectors; global manufacturing process technology; and IT operations in Brazil. Janis gained diverse experience building global teams early in her career at Texas Instruments where she held positions in finance; supply chain; business process engineering; IT; and quality. Most recently; Janis has been serving as Chief Operating Officer for the Memphis Academy of Science and Engineering. /brJanis holds a Bachelor degree in Business Administration from Texas Tech University and a Master of Science degree in Administration from the University of Texas. /brAbout Glatfelter /brHeadquartered in York; PA; Glatfelter is a global supplier of specialty papers and fiber based engineered products; offering over a century of experience; technical expertise and world class service. U.S. operations include facilities in Spring Grove; PA; and Chillicothe and Fremont; OH. International operations include facilities in Canada; Germany; France; the United Kingdom; and the Philippines; a representative office in China; and a sales and distribution office in Russia. Glatfelter’s sales approximate $1.4 billion annually and its common stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol GLT. Additional information is available at www.glatfelter.com. /brContacts /brGlatfelter/brInvestors:/brJohn P. Jacunski; 717 225 2794 john.jacunski@glatfelter.com/bror/brMedia:/brWilliam T. Yanavitch/br717 225 2747 william.yanavitch@glatfelter.com

headline: Gemini announces new executive appointment
The full text of the press release: Gemini announces new executive appointment/brPosted on: Fri; 17 Sep 2010 09:33:44 EDT/br/brSep 17; 2010 (Datamonitor via COMTEX)    /brGemini Corporation; which provides services to oil and gas industries; has announced the addition of Roderick Facey to its executive team as vice president of technology solutions. /brIn addition; Gemini has announced the transition of Carl Johnson from executive chairman to chairman of the board for the corporation. /brMr Facey has held a number of senior management positions throughout his more than 20 year professional career undertaking work in the areas of water and wastewater engineering; industrial waste; renewable energy; and heavy oil related projects. /brMr Facey has been employed with Gemini since 2004 and has been actively involved in the company's delivery of several innovative technology solutions. His knowledge and experience will be of significant benefit to Gemini and its clients as new technologies continue to be developed and enhanced within the company's target markets. He will also be involved in the training and mentoring of engineering staff as part of Gemini's career path management initiatives. /brCarl Johnson; chairman of the board of Gemini; said: "I have been pleased to watch the growth of the organization over its quarter century of operation; especially in our ability to provide value to our clients and career development opportunities for our employees."

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: DTT Surveillance Strengthens its Management Team
The full text of the press release: DTT Surveillance Strengthens its Management Team /brAs DTT Surveillance continues to grow within the surveillance space as the industry leader; its team of experienced professionals grows as well. /brLos Angeles; CA (PRWEB) October 14; 2010 /brAs DTT Surveillance continues to grow within the surveillance space as the industry leader; its team of experienced professionals grows as well. Most recently; DTT announced the appointment of a new Chief Information Officer (CIO); Matthew Kravitz. Matthew has 15 years of executive and consulting experience helping companies build better customer relationships; increase revenue; and decrease costs by realizing operational efficiencies. After graduating from Emory University; he developed his business and technical experience through an executive MBA and 10 years of management consulting at IBM; Oracle; and PWC. Matthew is currently leading the charge of implementing corporate “best practices” at DTT; learned from his experiences consulting with world class high tech service organizations such as GE; Cisco; Sun Microsystems; and VMware. Five years ago; Matthew relocated to Los Angeles and has never looked back. “It is a real thrill being a part of such a dynamic and thriving organization. We are now embarking on a roadmap that will employ world class best practices in order to execute CEO; Sam Naficy’s vision of making DTT 'the best vendor you have ever dealt with;'" stated Matthew. "Our dynamic organization and cutting edge technologies will allow DTT to sustain the same level of Customer Service and satisfaction through the next wave of dramatic growth.”/brAt the same time; Vic Herrera was named Chief Technology Officer; (CTO) for DTT. In this new role; Vic will be leading a team of IT professionals responsible for all technology initiatives including DTT’s mission critical infrastructure and internal functions. Vic brings years of technical experience to DTT; he worked at Interaccess in Chicago; which was acquired in 1999; as well as with Divine’s Senior Systems Engineering group. Vic started with DTT 6 years ago when it had just 25 employees and has played a major role in its continued growth year after year./brAbout DTT Surveillance /brHeadquartered in Los Angeles; California; DTT provides Digital Video Surveillance solutions for the Restaurant and Hospitality industries. DTT was founded in 1999 by Sam Naficy; leveraging the power of emerging digital technology to support the needs of a broad base of clientele. Since first launched; DTT has equipped; serviced and supported more than 25;000 clients. Every day; software provided by DTT handles over 6 trillion frames; protects multi trillion in assets; and oversees millions of employees. For more information on the company; or its products and services please visit http://www.dttusa.com or call (800) 933 8388

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: The Marcus Corporation: Announces new management positions
Industry: Travel; Recreation & Leisure : Travel; Recreation & Leisure Other
The full text of the press release: The Marcus Corporation: Announces new management positions/br9/14/2010/br/brMilwaukee; Wis.; September 14; 2010. . . . .The Marcus Corporation (NYSE: MCS); today announced new management positions in its Marcus Theatres® and Marcus® Hotels and Resorts divisions and in its corporate legal department./br/brPeter Engel has been named chief technology officer for Marcus Hotels and Resorts. In his new role; he will direct the division’s technology strategy; implementation and operations. Engel joined The Marcus Corporation in 2004 as director of technology. A 30 year veteran of the information technology industry; he comes from a consulting and technology operations background./br/brPrior to joining The Marcus Corporation; he served as president of Aperias Management Services; a consulting firm specializing in information technology and strategic management consulting services. Engel has 15 years of experience in the travel and leisure industry; including serving as chief operating officer for Trisept Solutions; and senior vice president at The Mark Travel Corporation. He is a member of the Hospitality Financial and Technology Professionals and Hotel Technology Next Generation./br/brKim Lueck has been named chief information technology officer for Marcus Theatres. In her new role; she will assume responsibility for the division’s technology strategy and implementation. Lueck joined Marcus Theatres in 1997 as IT manager; and later served as IT director for the Baymont and KFC divisions. In 1999; she received the Marcus Theatres “Spotlight on Excellence” award for her leadership role in implementing the division’s first phone ticketing sales system; print at home ticketing and data warehouse capabilities./br/brLueck played a key role in the overnight technology conversions for the company’s acquisitions of Cinema Entertainment Corporation in 2007 and the Douglas Theatre Company in 2008. Lueck has/br/brchaired the Advisory Board of Radiant Systems; an entertainment industry technology provider; for the past six years. She participates on several National Association of Theatre Owners (NATO) committees and volunteers with organizations including Variety; COA Youth & Family Centers; the Multiple Scoliosis Society; The Gathering; United Performing Arts Fund (UPAF) and the United Way. She also serves on the United Way Emerging Leaders Council./br/brMichael Kohler has been named senior counsel for The Marcus Corporation. In his new role; Kohler will represent the company’s theatre and hotel divisions before federal and state administrative agencies throughout the country in all areas of employment law. Kohler will also be responsible for counseling and training the company’s managers and human resource directors on labor and employment law related issues; assist in union negotiations and represent the company in labor arbitrations./br/brPrior to joining The Marcus Corporation in 2005; Kohler was an associate at Foley & Lardner; LLP in Milwaukee. Kohler received a dual bachelor’s degree in business administration and history from Marquette University in 1996 and obtained his law degree from the University of Illinois in 2000. In addition to his work at The Marcus Corporation; he teaches as an adjunct professor at Marquette University’s College of Business and frequently provides lectures on employment and labor law topics to classes and professional groups. He also serves as a member of the Board of Directors for the Great Lakes Hemophilia Foundation as well as the Association of Corporate Counsel – Wisconsin Chapter./br/brAbout The Marcus Corporation/br/brHeadquartered in Milwaukee; Wisconsin; The Marcus Corporation is a leader in the lodging and entertainment industries. The Marcus Corporation’s movie theatre division; Marcus Theatres®; currently owns or manages 668 screens at 54 locations in Wisconsin; Illinois; Iowa; Minnesota; Nebraska; North Dakota and Ohio; and one family entertainment center in Wisconsin. The company’s lodging division; Marcus Hotels and Resorts; owns or manages 19 hotels; resorts and other properties in ten states. For more information; visit the company’s web site at http://www.marcuscorp.com.

The full text of the press release: Huron Consulting Group Names CIO/brHuron Consulting Group (NASDAQ: HURN); a leading provider of business consulting services; today announced that Vincent A. Marin has been appointed as the Company’s chief information officer./br“Huron’s information management requirements have grown to a point where we needed someone who understood the consulting industry and the demands of a mobile work force that assists clients with complex business matters around the world;” said James H. Roth; chief executive officer; Huron Consulting Group. “We look forward to Vince’s leadership in his new role and we are pleased to welcome him to Huron.”/brMarin is a consulting industry veteran with more than 20 years of professional services experience working in various IT roles where he helped companies with their information management organization; and provided integral support by carrying out the IT strategy and implementation. At Huron; Marin will be working to advance the Company’s internal information technology strategy to align with the Company’s long term business goals. /brMarin comes to Huron from McKinsey & Company where he served as the Director of IT Services for the Americas Region. During his 16 years there; he was responsible for transforming IT from a support function to a key partner by significantly enhancing the global IT capabilities; benefiting the firm and its clients. Previously; he was an adjunct professor at DePaul teaching MBA and MIS classes; which emphasized using IT to achieve business objectives./brAbout Huron Consulting Group/brHuron Consulting Group helps clients in diverse industries improve performance; comply with complex regulations; reduce costs; recover from distress; leverage technology; and stimulate growth. The Company teams with its clients to deliver sustainable and measurable results. Huron provides services to a wide variety of both financially sound and distressed organizations; including leading academic institutions; healthcare organizations; Fortune 500 companies; medium sized businesses; and the law firms that represent these various organizations. Learn more at www.huronconsultinggroup.com.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Anil Jwalanna Joins iCharts as CTO
Industry: Software & Internet : Data Analytics; Management and Storage
The full text of the press release: September 16; 2010 08:04 AM Eastern Daylight Time /brAnil Jwalanna Joins iCharts as Chief Technology Officer/br/brSUNNYVALE; Calif.  (BUSINESS WIRE)  iCharts; the leading provider of interactive visual reporting solutions for market research and survey data; today announced that Anil Jwalanna has joined the firm as Chief Technology Officer. Anil will be responsible for engineering; software architecture; and customer support and will play a key role in the strategic direction of the company./br/br “Anil brings a tremendous depth of technology knowledge and over 15 years of experience in data management; business intelligence; data analytics and systems architecture”/br/br“Anil brings a tremendous depth of technology knowledge and over 15 years of experience in data management; business intelligence; data analytics and systems architecture;” said Seymour Duncker; CEO of iCharts. “These are all critical areas for us as we move our business to the next level of growth. Coupled with his extensive management experience; Anil promises to be an invaluable member of our team.”/br/brJwalanna joins iCharts with nineteen years of technology experience devoted to helping companies competitively leverage technology. His most recent position was Assistant Vice President of Enterprise Architecture and IT Application Services for Fireman’s Fund Insurance Company; an Allianz Company. Allianz is one of the largest insurance groups in the world. During his tenure at Fireman’s Fund; he was responsible for strategic architecture and led several critical strategic initiatives including a data strategy program; SOA competency centers for BRMS; BPM; content management and data governance. He has a BS in Mechanical Engineering from Mysore University; India; and jointly earned MBAs from UC Berkeley and Columbia Schools of Business./br/br“iCharts will allow me to make extensive use of my technical knowledge and entrepreneurial expertise; and I look forward to becoming part of iCharts’ impressive leadership team. Today; market research data is a treasure trove of business and competitive information; but most people are unable to access it easily. iCharts can act as a window into that data and help business leaders quickly focus on the data they need to drive their businesses more effectively. I am excited about my role at iCharts as we help customers unlock the value of data and transform that information into strategic business insights;” said Jwalanna./br/brAbout iCharts/br/briCharts is the leader in interactive visual reporting solutions; we make it simple to explore; create and distribute interactive visual reports from market research and survey data./br/briCharts was founded in 2007; and launched as a finalist at TechCrunch50 in San Francisco in 2008. iCharts has offices in Silicon Valley; USA and has teams in Munich; Germany and une; India.

headline: Ingenico names Matthias Schulz CTO
The full text of the press release: Ingenico names Matthias Schulz CTO/brIngenico; the leading worldwide provider of payment solutions; today announces the appointment of Matthias Schulz as the company's new Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and member of the Management Board; reporting to Philippe Lazare; CEO Ingenico. /brMatthias will be in charge of defining the Group payment and value added transactions infrastructure roadmap; and of leading its implementation. He will work in close relationship with the entities and the managers of the Group involved in transaction management; in order to set up and ensure required performance and efficiency of our infrastructure to fulfil our customer needs./brI am very pleased to welcome Matthias Schulz in his new role of CTO" commented Philippe Lazare; CEO Ingenico; "Matthias was the CIO of easycash and has successfully implemented the project that enables easycash to have its independent processing system. We look forward having his strong contribution to prepare the future technical grounds of our services offer"./brMatthias Schulz; 47 years old; holds a Dipl. Inform. (univ) / MSCS in computer science from the Friedrich Alexander University Erlangen Nuremberg; Germany. He started his career as IT manager and application developer for Bischoff Logistics Systems Holding GmbH in Nuremberg; Germany. He then was project manager at INA Wälzlager Schaeffler KG. In 1999; he joined; as head of banking applications; Quellebank; later Entrium Direct Bankers AG; which merged with DiBa to the ING DiBa Germany. After three years as CIO of ING DiBa Austria; Matthias joined in 2008 easycash; an Ingenico company.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Inspire Pharma appoints Robert M. Savel to Senior VP and CTO
Industry: Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech : Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech Other
The full text of the press release: September 01; 2010 06:30 AM Eastern Daylight Time /brInspire Names Robert Savel as Senior Vice President and Chief Technical Officer/br/brDURHAM; N.C.  (BUSINESS WIRE)  Inspire Pharmaceuticals; Inc. (NASDAQ: ISPH) announced today the appointment of Robert M. Savel; II; to the position of Senior Vice President and Chief Technical Officer; effective September 20; 2010. In this role; Mr. Savel will be responsible for all manufacturing and technical operations and will report directly to Adrian Adams; President and CEO./br/br“We are pleased to add Bob to the Inspire leadership team in the important role of Chief Technical Officer as we continue to structure the organization for sustainable success. Bob has more than 20 years of experience in multiple facets of manufacturing and operations; including managing clinical and commercial scale pharmaceutical manufacturing. Bob’s expertise will be invaluable to Inspire as we prepare for the potential commercial launch of denufosol tetrasodium for cystic fibrosis and continue to execute against our strategic corporate objectives in both the ophthalmic and pulmonary areas of our business;” stated Mr. Adams./br/brMr. Savel; age 42; has extensive experience in operations; quality and supply chain management in both commercial and research and development areas. Most recently; Mr. Savel served as President of Savel Enterprises LLC and; prior to that; held the position of Senior Vice President; Technical Operations at PDL Biopharma from 2007 until 2008. At PDL; Mr. Savel was responsible for clinical and commercial manufacturing; quality and supply chain functions across multiple sites. Prior to joining PDL; Mr. Savel held roles of increasing responsibility at Johnson & Johnson from 1999 to 2007; most recently serving as North America Vice President of Quality and Compliance for the J&J Global Pharmaceutical Sourcing Group. In this capacity; Mr. Savel directed quality and manufacturing compliance for approximately 40 manufacturing; contract manufacturing; or distribution sites for multiple Johnson & Johnson subsidiary companies; including ALZA Corporation; Ortho McNeil Pharmaceutical; Ortho Biotech and Janssen and served on the North American Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Board. While at Johnson & Johnson; he also held the positions of Vice President of Quality; J&J (ALZA); Senior Director of Manufacturing; J&J (ALZA); Director of Pharmaceutical Manufacturing; J&J (Ortho McNeil Pharmaceutical) and Director of Semi Solid Manufacturing; J&J (Ortho McNeil Pharmaceutical). Prior to that; Mr. Savel held positions as a principal consultant at PricewaterhouseCoopers and management positions at Ingersoll Rand Corporation. Mr. Savel received a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University./br/brAbout Inspire/br/brInspire is a biopharmaceutical company focused on researching; developing and commercializing prescription pharmaceutical products for ophthalmic and pulmonary diseases. Inspire’s goal is to build and commercialize a sustainable portfolio of innovative new products based on its technical; scientific and commercial expertise. Inspire’s clinical pipeline includes denufosol tetrasodium for cystic fibrosis in Phase 3 development and AZASITE® (azithromycin ophthalmic solution) 1% for blepharitis in Phase 2 development. Inspire receives revenues related to the promotion of AZASITE for bacterial conjunctivitis; the co promotion of ELESTAT® (epinastine HCl ophthalmic solution) 0.05% for allergic conjunctivitis and royalties based on net sales of RESTASIS® (cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion) 0.05% for dry eye. For more information; visit www.inspirepharm.com.

about person: Most recently; Mr. Savel served as President of Savel Enterprises LLC and; prior to that; held the position of Senior Vice President; Technical Operations at PDL Biopharma from 2007 until 2008.
