title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Dr. Ciprian Popoviciu Joins TechnoDyne's Management Team
The full text of the press release: Dr. Ciprian Popoviciu Joins TechnoDyne's Management Team /br23 October 2010/brProfessional Services Close Up/brechnoDyne; an information technology services company; announced that Dr. Ciprian Popoviciu has joined its management team as Distinguished Architect in the Office of the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and as a Director in the Enterprise Solutions Group./brDr. Popoviciu will head the Network Infrastructure Practice in the Enterprise Solutions Group focused on delivering next generation IT solutions to clients. His networking and data center expertise will help position TechnoDyne for delivering solutions to the marketplace. Dr. Popoviciu's industry recognized IPv6 leadership underscores TechnoDyne's commitment to support its customers' transitions to the next generation Internet Protocol./brMost recently; Dr. Popoviciu managed the architecture team for Cisco's Engineering Infrastructure Services organization where he helped develop the strategy and drove the execution of the data center consolidation and transition to cloud. Over his 13 year career at Cisco; Dr. Popoviciu worked in the Customer Advocacy; Solution Test and Architecture organizations./br"Dr. Popoviciu brings to the team industry recognized technical expertise in IPv6 and proven strategic leadership and execution in cloud enablement;" said Murali Swaminathan; Vice President and General Manager of the Enterprise Solutions Group at TechnoDyne. "He will develop our infrastructure strategy and support the CTO office in shaping the Enterprise 3.0 vision as TechnoDyne accelerates its path to the billion dollar goal."/brInstrumental in creating multi million dollar strategic partnerships; Dr. Popoviciu has also worked with service providers; enterprises and governments worldwide on IPv6 strategies; solutions and transition planning. He has a passion for transforming education through technology and plays an active role in education initiatives at the local; national and international level.
what happened: TechnoDyne appointed Ciprian Popoviciu as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Previously; Cirprian Popoviciu managed the architecture team for Cisco's Engineering Infrastructure Services organization where he helped develop the strategy and drove the execution of the data center consolidation and transition to cloud.
about company: TechnoDyne is a fast growing information technology services firm that delivers services to government agencies and private sector enterprises.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: TelCordia Addresses Challenges that CSPs Face
The full text of the press release: TelCordia Addresses Challenges that CSPs Face/brTelcordia; a global leader in the development of mobile; broadband and enterprise communications software and services; is capitalizing on its core strength of delivering value to its customers by expanding the role of Adan K. Pope; currently chief strategy officer; to include a new Chief Technology Officer role. /brHis new responsibilities will be to contribute to the overall corporate strategy and goal setting; cross solution synergies for the company's portfolio of products and services and building of strategic partnerships around the world./brThis is perhaps relevant in the current scenario; where communications service providers have necessarily to tackle the complex mix of technology evolution alongside business process transformation. Dealing with pressures of competition; customer experience management; real time services; and IT regulatory compliance only adds more challenges./brTo help evaluate their challenges; create revenue generating opportunities; develop solutions that work the first time; Telcordia has the depth of expertise to fully understand situations; has the ability to respond appropriately; and the capacity to deliver as promised. As the industry's go to expert for solving the most complex communications challenges; Telcordia has globally trusted expertise in software and services to meet the needs of customers and partners./brPope; who joined Telcordia in 2008; and in addition to Chief Strategy Officer; and now takes on the role of Chief Technology Officer; aims to change things by leveraging customer's assets and core competencies to generate profitable new revenue streams./brA 20 plus year industry veteran; Pope began his career with AT&T Bell labs in the 1980s. His technical strategy and leadership enabled entry into new markets. He has earned several technology patents./br"Our customers are tired of hearing about becoming 'dumb pipes' and being left out of the value chain;" said Pope; and added that they would work actively to identify business opportunities; solve communications problems as and when they arose; regardless of their complexity to help them realize their full potential./brHeadquartered in Piscataway; N.J; with offices throughout North America; Europe; Asia; Central and Latin America; Telcordia enables Communications Service Providers; enterprises; suppliers and governments to successfully deploy innovative and advanced services that help clients realize operational efficiencies; drive revenue; and maintain a competitive edge. /brIn a related news release; Telcordia; announced its new Telcordia Bandwidth Manager to address the issues of network congestion as the explosive growth in mobile broadband continues to surge leaving Communications Service Providers struggling to increase profitability while competing to win in the race for mobile broadband.
what happened: Telcordia appointed Adan Pope as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Prior to joining Telcordia; Mr. Pope was CTO (Americas) and Vice President at Cramer.
about company: Telcordia Technologies; formerly Bell Communications Research; Inc. (Bellcore); is the industry’s go to expert for solving the most complex communications challenges.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: LaNeve takes on more duties in Allstate shakeup
Industry: Financial Services : Insurance and Risk Management
The full text of the press release: LaNeve takes on more duties in Allstate shakeup/br/brBy Becky Yerak/brPosted Oct. 21 at 4:31 p.m./br/brLess than a year after taking the chief marketing job at Allstate Corp.; Mark LaNeve is taking on a greater role at the Northbrook based home and auto insurer./br/brAs part of a leadership shakeup; the former General Motors Corp. sales executive will also oversee Allstate’s agency sales operations; in addition to his current role in marketing. The combined marketing and sale unit will report to both Chief Executive Tom Wilson and to Joe Lacher; president of Allstate Protection./br/br“This change leverages LaNeve’s strong background in sales and further expands his insurance expertise;” Allstate said in a memo obtained by the Tribune./br/brAlso; 33 year Allstate veteran Joe Richardson; senior vice president of product distribution; has left Allstate./br/brThe restructuring also affects Catherine Brune; Allstate’s high profile chief information officer. She joins Allstate’s protection unit as field president for the south regions; which include Florida and Texas./br/brShe’ll continue to lead Allstate’s technology operations until her successor is named. A search is under way for “someone with deep expertise in technology trends; such as mobility and connectivity;” Allstate said in its memo./br/brAn Allstate spokeswoman declined to comment on whether the restructuring; which also includes other leadership changes and aims to result in a “flatter” structure with more accountability; will lead to additional job cuts.
what happened: Catherine Brune resigned as Chief Information Officer of Allstate Corp
about person: Catherine Brune joined Allstate in 1976; eventually became VP of technology shared services; and was named SVP and CIO in September 2002.
about company: The Allstate Corporation (NYSE:ALL) is the nation’s largest publicly held personal lines insurer. Widely known through the “You’re In Good Hands With Allstate®” slogan; Allstate helps individuals in approximately 17 million households protect what they have today and better prepare for tomorrow through approximately 14;800 exclusive agencies and financial representatives in the U.S. and Canada.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Burger King Holdings; Inc. Announces Senior Management Changes
The full text of the press release: Burger King Holdings; Inc. Announces Senior Management Changes /brMonday; October 25th; 2010 at 8:03 am /brMIAMI (Restaurant News Release) Burger King Holdings; Inc. (the “Company”) today announced changes to its senior management team./brEffective immediately; the following executives have been appointed to their respective new roles:/br• Jonathan Fitzpatrick; Executive Vice President; Global Operations. Mr. Fitzpatrick was previously the Company’s Senior Vice President of Operations; Europe; Middle East and Africa. He will be based in Miami./br• Heitor Goncalves; Executive Vice President; Chief Information and Performance Officer. Mr. Goncalves worked previously for Ambev and InBev; where he served in multiple strategic roles; including corporate development and logistics. He will be based in Miami./br• Greg Ryan; Executive Vice President; President of Latin America and the Caribbean. Mr. Ryan brings extensive fast food experience that includes being a McDonald’s franchise owner in Brazil. He will be based in Miami./br• Daniel Schwartz; Executive Vice President; Deputy Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Schwartz was most recently a partner at 3G Capital and will partner closely with Ben Wells; the Company’s Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. He will be based in Miami./br• Jose Tomas; Executive Vice President; Chief Human Resources and Communications Officer. Mr. Tomas was previously the Company’s Vice President of Human Resources. He will remain based in Miami./br• Steve Wiborg; Executive Vice President; President of North America. Mr. Wiborg joins the Company from Heartland Food Corporation; one of the BURGER KING® system’s largest franchise operators; where he served as President and Chief Executive Officer. He will be based in Miami./brThe following executives will continue to serve on the senior management team:/br• Anne Chwat; Executive Vice President; General Counsel and Corporate Secretary; a position she has held since September 2004. Ms. Chwat will also continue to serve as President of the HAVE IT YOUR WAY® Foundation; the BURGER KING® system’s philanthropic arm. Ms. Chwat will remain based in Miami./br• Natalia Franco; Executive Vice President; Global Chief Marketing Officer; a role she has held since April 2010. Prior to joining the Company; Ms. Franco served as Vice President; Global Marketing and Innovation for The Coca Cola Company; where she was responsible for all cross functional marketing efforts for the McDonald’s Division. Ms. Franco will remain based in Miami./br• Peter Tan; Executive Vice President; President of Asia Pacific; a position he has held since November 2005. Prior to joining the Company; Mr. Tan served as Corporate Senior Vice President and President of Greater China for McDonald’s Corporation. Mr. Tan will remain based in Singapore./br• Ben Wells; Executive Vice President; Chief Financial Officer; a role he has held since April 2006. From May 2005 to April 2006; Mr. Wells served as the Company’s Senior Vice President; Treasurer. Mr. Wells will remain based in Miami./brThe company is near finalizing a selection for the Executive Vice President; President of Europe; Middle East and Africa./brAs previously announced; Bernardo Hees has been named Chief Executive Officer of the Company; and Alex Behring; Managing Partner of 3G Capital; has been named Co Chairman of the Board of the Company; alongside John Chidsey; formerly Chairman and Chief Executive Officer./br“I’m pleased to announce the senior management team that will lead Burger King Holdings; Inc. as we take the next steps to strengthen and enhance the BURGER KING® brand;” said Bernardo Hees; Chief Executive Officer of the Company. “These executives bring a wealth of experience to their positions and I’m confident that the BURGER KING® brand and our business will thrive under their leadership. I look forward to working with them to capitalize on the many global opportunities that lie ahead.”/brAs a result of these appointments; the Company also announced the departure of Gladys DeClouet Mims; Senior Vice President; U.S. and Canada Company Operations; Chuck Fallon; Executive Vice President; President North America; Kevin Higgins; Executive Vice President; President Europe Middle East and Africa; Julio Ramirez; Executive Vice President Global Operations; Peter Smith; Executive Vice President; Chief Human Resources Officer; Raj Rawal; Senior Vice President; Chief Information Officer; and Amy Wagner; Senior Vice President; Investor Relations and Global Communications./br“I would like to express my gratitude to Gladys; Chuck; Kevin; Julio; Peter; Raj and Amy for their commitment and many contributions to the Company;” commented Hees. “Each has played an important role to improve the overall positioning of the Company and we sincerely thank them for their years of service.”/brAbout Burger King Holdings; Inc./brThe BURGER KING® system operates more than 12;150 restaurants in all 50 states and in 76 countries and U.S. territories worldwide. Approximately 90 percent of BURGER KING® restaurants are owned and operated by independent franchisees; many of them family owned operations that have been in business for decades. In 2008; Fortune magazine ranked Burger King Corp. (BKC) among America’s 1;000 largest corporations. BKC was recognized by Interbrand on its top 100 “Best Global Brands” list and Ad Week has named it one of the top three industry changing advertisers within the last three decades. To learn more about Burger King Corp.; please visit the Company’s Web site at http://www.bk.com.
what happened: Burger King appointed Heitor Goncalves as Chief Information Officer
about person: Heitor Goncalves was previously a Business Consultant at 3G Capital.
about company: The BURGER KING® system operates more than 12;150 restaurants in all 50 states and in 76 countries and U.S. territories worldwide.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Breaking news: State chief info officer resigns for federal post
The full text of the press release: Chronicling civil service life for California state workers/brOctober 25; 2010/brBreaking news: State chief info officer resigns for federal post/br/br100816 Teri_Takai2.jpgCalifornia's chief information officer; Teri Takai; has resigned from state government's top tech job effective Nov. 5. Chief Deputy Director Christy Quinlan will taking over as acting CIO./br/brIn an e mail to department staff sent this afternoon; Takai confirmed that she is leaving to take a job in President Barack Obama's administration. The job had been on hold for several months; as we reported here./br/brTakai's resignation comes a week after her deputy CIO; Mike Locatis; took the top CIO post with the federal Department of Energy./br/brHere's Takai's e mail:/br/br From: Takai; Teri@CIO/br Sent: Monday; October 25; 2010 1:03 PM/br To: CIO All/br Subject: Thank You/br/br Dear Friends and Colleagues;/br/br I have accepted a position in the Obama Administration as the Chief Information Officer for the U.S. Department of Defense; and my last day of service in California will be November 5; 2010. Chief Deputy Director Christy Quinlan will be Acting Chief Information Officer during the transition./br/br It has been a tremendous honor to serve as Governor Schwarzenegger's chief technology advisor and State Chief Information Officer; especially during a critical time of change for California's IT program. When I arrived in Sacramento nearly three years ago; the Office of the State Chief Information Officer (OCIO) had just been created in statute. We set out to implement the Governor's agenda to transform and modernize California's aging technology infrastructure. Starting next year; the California Technology Agency will move forward as envisioned by the Legislature and Governor as technology continues to play a vital role in delivering services to our constituents./br/br Although there is still a lot to be done; so much has been accomplished thanks to the hard work; vision and support of Governor Schwarzenegger; Susan Kennedy; cabinet members; legislative leaders and IT professionals throughout the state./br/br I especially want to thank the agency and department CIOs for their leadership and many contributions to our community. On behalf of the OCIO; we appreciate the support; interaction and time spent to dive with us into the details of policies and projects./br/br Most of all; I want to thank the OCIO Team; including the Program Management Office; IT Policy Office; Office of Information Security; Public Safety Communications Division; Office of Technology Services; Enterprise Solutions and Services Unit and Executive Office for working so hard to serve the people of this state. Whether working nights and weekends to move a data center with no interruption of service; building high profile websites or designing the next generation of emergency radio systems; the talent and dedication of our Team is unparalleled. With the budget crisis; organizational changes and so many challenges to overcome; you have done such an incredible job; and with a great attitude and true spirit of public service. I will miss working with you all   keep up the terrific work!/br/br I will cherish my time spent here in California and look forward to serving the public in my new position./br/br Teri Takai/br State Chief Information Officer
what happened: California Department of Insurance appointed Christy Quinlan as Chief Information Officer
about person: Christy is Chief Deputy Director; Office of the State Chief Information Officer; of the state of California.
about company: The California Department of Insurance is responsible for enforcing many of the insurance related laws of the state.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Gov. Ed Rendell's chief information officer Brenda Orth to resign Oct. 31
The full text of the press release: Gov. Ed Rendell's chief information officer Brenda Orth to resign Oct. 31/brPublished: Wednesday; October 20; 2010; 1:49 PM /brAs Gov. Ed Rendell's administration winds to a close; his top level staff continues to find their way to the exit; and the next one to the door is chief information officer Brenda Orth./brOrth is resigning at the end of the month from her position of overseeing and coordinating information technology services for the commonwealth./brThe commonwealth's chief technology officer; Tony Encinias; will serve as interim chief information officer while retaining his current position./brOrth was appointed to her current post in January 2008. She previously served as chief technology officer for the commonwealth and has been employed by the commonwealth since 2003.

title: Vice President; Information Technology Division
headline: The Motorists Insurance Group Makes Changes to Leadership Team
Industry: Financial Services : Insurance and Risk Management
The full text of the press release: Columbus; Ohio based Motorists Insurance Group has announced changes to its leadership team. The following changes are effective immediately:Grady B. Campbell has been promoted to senior vice president; Marketing Services and Personal Lines; and will report to David L. Kaufman; executive vice president. He will be responsible for Motorists' Property and Casualty Marketing Division; the Personal Lines Division and the MAX Service Division. His replacement as vice president; Property and Casualty Marketing; will be named later.Mike Agan has been named vice president; Personal Lines. He and Ralph W. Smithers Jr.; vice president MAX Service Division; will also report to Campbell.Randy Rudowicz will become vice president; Strategic Planning; Products and Services Division; and will report to Susan Haack; senior vice president and corporate secretary.Charles Stapleton has expanded responsibilities as senior vice president; Commercial Lines and Affiliate Operations. He will assume responsibility for American Hardware Mutual in addition to his current duties overseeing Iowa Mutual; Phenix Mutual and Motorists' Commercial Lines Division. Stapleton will serve on the Operations Committee of all companies in the group and will report to Kaufman.John Kessler; vice president; Information Technology Division; has been named chief information officer for all companies in our group. In addition to his continuing tactical responsibilities as head of the Information Technology Division; he will also be responsible for strategic IT initiatives across our group of companies. Kessler will report to Kaufman.Chuck Wickert; senior vice president; Life Operations and Corporate Services; will also report to Kaufman with no change in responsibilities.Haack will now oversee the Claims Division. Karen Schwartz; vice president; Claims Division; Chuck Gaskill; General Counsel; and Craig Thompson; assistant vice president; Internal Audit will report to Haack.Kaufman; Haack; Michael Wiseman; treasurer and chief financial officer; and Robert Western; president and chief operating officer; Wilson Mutual Insurance; will continue to report to Motorists Insurance Group Chairman; President and CEO John J. Bishop

Motorists' personal lines; commercial lines and life insurance products are sold by a network of more than 2;800 agents working through approximately 600 independent agencies in a market of more than 32 million people.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Holden accepts technology director's resignation
The full text of the press release: Holden accepts technology director's resignation/brMayor president Kip Holden announced today he has accepted the resignation of the city parish’s technology director; Don Evans; whose name surfaced in a federal probe involving an alleged kickback scheme./brHolden on Thursday accepted Evans’ resignation; which will be effective Oct. 31; according to a city parish news release today./brHe has been placed on leave from the job; effective immediately; the release says./brFederal prosecutors in New Orleans allege Evans and the city parish technology director in Lafayette accepted bribes to award millions of dollars of no bid business to a crime camera company whose owner is under felony indictment./brNeither Evans nor former Lafayette city parish Chief Information Officer Keith Thibodeaux; who was fired Wednesday; is charged with any offense in the case./brAssistant U.S. Attorney Matthew S. Chester in New Orleans is asking court permission to include evidence of the alleged bribes during the January bribery and kickback trial of Mark St. Pierre; 47; of Belle Chasse; and two New Orleans defendants./brA combined total of more than $100;000 in improper benefits were received by the municipal officials in Lafayette and Baton Rouge; Chester wrote U.S. District Judge Eldon E. Fallon./brChester told the judge that Evans steered crime camera work to Pierre’s company; NetMethods; after receiving gifts that included “tickets to approximately four New Orleans Saints football games; a 50th birthday party extravaganza … and overnight trips at various hotels in New Orleans.”/brNetMethods later was awarded approximately $3.5 million from the city parish to establish a wireless network of surveillance cameras and a gunshot detection system in high crime areas in Baton Rouge.
what happened: Keith Thibodeaux resigned as Chief Information Officer of St. Mary Parish School Board
about person: Keith Thibodeaux previously held various technology positions at the St. Mary Parish school.
about company: The St. Mary Parish school district represents a highly progressive; dynamic; educational organization focused on the academic achievement of all students.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: SBA names new CIO; COO going back to FTC
The full text of the press release: SBA names new CIO; COO going back to FTC/brOctober 14; 2010   4:26pm/brThere are some major changes to the senior officials at the Small Business Administration. /brEileen Harrington; the SBA's chief operating officer; announced yesterday that she is leaving to become the new executive director of the Federal Trade Commission; SBA spokesman Jonathan Swain said. /brMeanwhile; Paul Christy had the acting removed from his title and now is the chief information officer; Swain confirmed. /brChristy's first official day as CIO was Tuesday. /brHe had been acting since Robert Naylor resigned in May. /brChristy had been SBA's chief technology officer since 2008 and worked as the deputy CIO for the International Trade Administration at the Department of Commerce. /brChristy has been in government for more than 30 years. /brHarrington's last day will be Oct. 22 and in the interim her duties will be shared by SBA deputy administrator Marie Johns and chief of staff Ana Ma; Swain said. /brPrior to coming to SBA; Harrington worked for FTC for 24 years where she spearheaded the implementation of the Do Not Call list.
what happened: SBA appointed Paul Christy as Chief Information Officer
about person: Paul Christy was previously the Deputy CIO; International Trade at U.S. Dept. of Commerce
about company: The U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) was created in 1953 as an independent agency of the federal government to aid; counsel; assist and protect the interests of small business concerns

title: Vice President
headline: Information technology VP Suzanne Montague to retire
The full text of the press release: Information technology VP Suzanne Montague to retire /brWritten by Edna Horton; The Shorthorn staff /brMonday; 06 September 2010 05:47 PM /br/brThe information technology vice president; who brought the MyMav student information system to UTA; will end her 28 year career run here in 2011./br/brSuzanne Montague began her career at UTA in 1982 as a programmer and took care of the payroll systems. /br/brShe said enjoyed it from the start because of the work environment with great people. /br/brMontague remembered; sometimes; having to bring her children to work when things went wrong./brSuzanne Montague/brSuzanne Montague began working at UTA in 1982. /brShe will officially retire Jan. 30. /brShe received her master’s degree in business at UTA in 1992. /brShe was responsible for establishing the MyMav student information system./br“I remember being here at 11 p.m.; with two kids in tow; because the payroll program broke;” she said. “I was responsible for it and I had to pull them out of bed and bring them up here.”/br/brIn 1992; Montague received her master’s degree in business from UTA because she wanted to further her career and keep up with the rapidly changing technology./br/br“I loved it. I loved school;” she said. “I’m not afraid to get excited the first day of class; to go in and see what you were going to be doing.”/br/brMontague said her two major accomplishments have been the MyMav student information system and the data center; which allowed the Information Technology office to have more space. /br/brMontague said the data center allowed UTA to connect with other campuses; like UT Tyler and UT Dallas. It also started for them a database similar to MyMav that can be used by students at those universities. Montague said the data center has helped refine their operations and has saved money so campus finances could be used in other places./br/br“When we bought that data center; we had more computer center space than we needed;” she said./br/brJon Harris; information technology infrastructure assistant vice president; worked with Montague for seven years. He said her hard work; dedication and love for UTA made her a good boss./br/br“I never saw her have a bad day;” he said. “She was very intuitive; and her ability to understand all sides of a problem and tell us which way to go made her a good [chief information officer].”/br/brHarris said Montague is respected in the community and everyone will miss her. He said working for Montague was a true inspiration./br/brMontague says she will travel with her husband and get things done around the house she was not able to complete while working. She also has a bucket list she is going to get through. The first on that list is spending more time with her children and grandchildren./br/br“There’s a lot of me things in there too;” she said. “I want to pleasure read. I want to work on my house. I want to go shopping when the world is not there on the weekends; where you can just walk in the store and there’s not a million people there.” /br/brMontague said her job at UTA is a very busy job and that retiring will take some time to get used to./br/br“I have loved working at this university – the people with whom I have worked; and that goes from the president all the way down to the students; the faculty; the deans; you name it;” she said. “I am so proud of what we have accomplished over the last few years and where I think we are going.” /br/brPresident James Spaniolo announced Montague’s retirement in an e mail to vice presidents and deans. In that e mail; he commented on how thankful he was for her service to the university./br/br“Suzanne worked her way up through the ranks at UT Arlington — earning her MBA here along the way — and for the past seven years has led our talented information technology team to achieve numerous milestones and successes;” he said. “She is a consummate professional and a valued colleague; and her contributions to the university are immeasurable.”/br/brProvost Donald Bobbitt said he also enjoyed working with Montague./br/br“I greatly enjoyed working with Ms. Montague;” he said via e mail. “She is a wonderful colleague and always has the best interests of the University of Texas at Arlington and our students in mind. She will be missed.”
what happened: Suzanne Montague retired as Vice President of University of Texas Arlington
about person: Suzanne Montague began working at UTA in 1982. She was responsible for establishing the MyMav student information system.
about company: The University of Texas at Arlington sets the standard for educational excellence in the thriving Dallas Fort Worth area. Through life enhancing research; innovative teaching and community service; UT Arlington Mavericks challenge convention and transform the world in which they live.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: NEWS  Tivus Names Chief Technology Officer
The full text of the press release: Wed. Oct. 27; 2010 HotShotStocks AT THE OPENMoneyTreeStockPicks – ILVC has seen + 2.96% and 360k in VOL – First 60 minutes of Market Open/brNEWS  Tivus Names Chief Technology Officer/brPosted on October 27; 2010 by admin/brPurely Penny Stock Alerts Newsletter/br/brIf you are having trouble viewing this message; please go to http://community.icontact.com/p/purelypennystocks/newsletters/hotpennystocks/posts/news tivus names chief technology officer [1] [2][3] [4] Tivus Names Chief Technology Officer TIVUS”>TIVUS is our Long Term Play; with more and more Due Diligence coming out and heavy hitters being named no wonder we are so bullish on TIVU.pk! NEWS OUT! TIVUS”>TIVUS PUBLICLY TRADES UNDER: TIVU.pk OMAHA; NE–(Marketwire – 10/27/10) – Tivus; Inc. (Pinksheets:TIVU – News); a provider of turnkey media entertainment technology to the hotel and hospitality industry; today announced it has named Mr. Randall Francis as the Company`s chief technology officer./br/br“I am delighted that Mr. Francis has agreed to become Tivus` chief technology officer;” commented Shiva Prakash; Tivus` president and chief executive officer. “He will oversee Tivus` entire technology platform from hardware & software to connectivity solutions; ensure appropriate selection and management of compatible vendors; and advance Tivus` technological advantage within the marketplace.” Mr. Francis has been an innovator in entertainment electronics since 1983. As national projects manager for Philips Electro Acoustics division in New Zealand; he developed an immersive virtual visitor`s center at a petrochemical plant using never before integrated technologies including a computer controlled synchronized Laservision disc; projection video; compact audio disc; and fiber optic lighting system allowing completely safe public tours./br/brIn the mid 1980s he designed; manufactured; and installed groundbreaking technologies to provide integrated hotel guestroom controls for lighting; air conditioning; and guestroom access in a high end Japanese hotel property./br/brThe customized solution utilized a soft touch; low voltage control system and televisions with a computerized central override providing evacuation messaging during emergencies./br/brDuring the 1990s; through his company CVS Interactive Ltd; Mr. Francis successfully managed the first deployment of On Demand video platforms to Hyatt; Sheraton; Regent; and other hotel properties in the Asia Pacific Rim for a major American Video On Demand franchise./br/br“I am pleased to be an integral part of the team tasked with completely changing the hotel entertainment industry;” commented Randall Francis. “I have been dedicated to developing IPTV technologies over the past 10 years and the IPTV industry has today matured to the point we can now successfully integrate current advertising delivery technology; market ready IPTV components; and newly deployed IPTV compatible content supplier channels to carry Tivus` interactive programming in a pure IP delivery environment on a global scale.” “High demand for Tivus` unique IPTV entertainment platform is anticipated; and I am confident the formidable task of simultaneously deploying scores of new hotel installations across North America is in uniquely capable hands;” Prakash concluded./br/brAbout Tivus; Inc./br/brTivus; Inc. is a technology entertainment services company that provides internet based TV and Cable programming; interactive game content; and goods & services to the hotel/hospitality industry. Using onsite hardware and software; including flat screen HD televisions; Tivus` unique IPTV hotel entertainment system is a complete; multifaceted entertainment platform that; for the first time in the industry; generates previously untapped income to the hotel through ad revenue sharing. For more information; please visit www.tivus.com.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: T Mobile USA completes president and CEO transition; Philipp Humm has the wheel
The full text of the press release: T Mobile USA completes president and CEO transition; Philipp Humm has the wheel/brT Mobile USA; Inc. today announced the completion of its senior leadership transition by confirming Philipp Humm as president and chief executive officer. Humm succeeds Robert Dotson; former president and CEO; who moves to vice chairman of the T Mobile USA Board. The company also re aligned several executive leadership roles; with all transitions effective Nov. 1; 2010. Cole Brodman; formerly T Mobile’s chief technology officer; steps into the role of chief marketing officer. Neville Ray; formerly T Mobile’s chief network officer; becomes chief technology officer for the company./br“T Mobile has grown into a strong consumer brand known for great value and recognized as a leader in customer service;” Humm said. “I am grateful for the opportunity to lead T Mobile toward future growth and plan to continually improve the way we serve our customers.”/brRené Obermann; CEO; of Deutsche Telekom said; “Philipp and Robert have chosen the right timing for this change. This move allows the new team to prepare a strong foundation for 2011 and forward. I hereby would like to thank Robert who has done an amazing job on bringing Philipp quickly up to speed on the critical issues and strategies facing the U.S. market. His commitment to a smooth transition will help ensure Philipp’s success.”/brHumm is an experienced Deutsche Telekom executive and former CEO of T Mobile Deutschland. He was previously responsible for sales and service in Europe as chief regional officer (CRO) Europe. Humm also brings significant U.S. market experience having 10 years of senior level experience at U.S. based companies including McKinsey & Company; Procter & Gamble; and Amazon before joining Deutsche Telekom./brHumm served as CEO of T Mobile Deutschland from 2005 until 2008. He took over a company in a declining market and successfully turned it around during his tenure to become Germany’s leading mobile operator in both subscribers and service revenues. Humm was also responsible for the successful market introduction of the iPhone® in Germany in 2007./brT Mobile’s executive leadership team reporting to Philipp Humm includes the following:/br• Cole Brodman; chief marketing officer; T Mobile USA/br• Jim Alling; chief operations officer; T Mobile USA/br• Neville Ray; chief technology officer; T Mobile USA/br• Brian Kirkpatrick; chief financial officer; T Mobile USA/br• Larry Myers; chief people officer; T Mobile USA/br• Dave Miller; general counsel and chief legal officer; T Mobile USA/br• Peter Ewens; chief strategy officer; T Mobile USA/brThe company remains focused on delivering innovative wireless products and services that help empower people to connect to those who matter most.
what happened: T Mobile USA; Inc. promoted Neville Ray to Chief Technology Officer
about person: Neville Ray has worked in the telecommunications industry for over 20 years with specific experience in the design; deployment and operational management of GSM wireless networks in the USA and worldwide.
about company: T Mobile has grown into a strong consumer brand known for great value and recognized as a leader in customer service

title: Vice President of Technology
headline: Tracker Corp Promotes David Ziegler to Vice President of Technology to Lead the Evolution of Immigration Management and I 9 Software
The full text of the press release: All Press Releases for October 28; 2010 » RSS Feed Printer Friendly Email It PDF Version Bookmark del.icio.us Diggs/br/brTracker Corp Promotes David Ziegler to Vice President of Technology to Lead the Evolution of Immigration Management and I 9 Software/brTracker Corp announced the promotion of David Ziegler to Vice President of Technology; to lead development of its software for I 9 compliance and immigration case management. /br/brNew Tracker Corp Logo/br/brNew Tacker Logo/br SAN FRANCISCO; CA; October 28; 2010 /24 7PressRelease/    Tracker Corp; innovative leaders in SaaS and enterprise software for I 9 compliance and immigration case management; announced the promotion of David Ziegler to Vice President of Technology./br/brDavid is responsible for development strategies of all Tracker Corp products; including ImmigrationTracker and Tracker I 9 software. An exemplary champion of continual product innovation at Tracker Corp; David leads an expert design and development team in step with market and customer demands. /br/brDavid began at Tracker almost a decade ago; as Employee #2; the company's first Technical Support Representative. His extensive product knowledge; combined with his background in customer service; allows him to strategically analyze product concepts and deliver the most useful features and functionality. He holds a BA in English and Mathematics from the University of Texas at Austin; an MA in English Literature from the University of California; Santa Barbara; and he has done extensive work toward his PhD. /br/br"David's unique combination of expert mathematical/technological skills; broad philosophical and aesthetic interests; and passion to discover and invent the most natural and efficient user experiences make him an ideal driver of innovative product development;" says Fred Colman; Tracker Corp founder and President. "David's vision and leadership are already paving the way for unprecedented Tracker software evolution. David has proven his ability to continually raise the bar in the compliance software arena."/br/brTracker Corp provides software for immigration management; I 9 compliance and E Verify. Used by approximately 75% of top rated immigration law firms and many Fortune 1000 companies; hospitals and universities; Tracker Corp products include ImmigrationTracker immigration management software and Tracker I 9 compliance software. Founded in 1998; Tracker Corp is privately held and based in San Francisco; CA. For more information; visit http://www.trackercorp.com./br/br/br   /brPress release service and press release distribution provided by http://www.24 7pressrelease.com/br/br# # #

title: Senior Vice President of Platform and Technology
headline: Online game developer and publisher Trion Worlds has appointed three new executives to its management team.
The full text of the press release: Trion Worlds Bolsters Executive Team/brSeptember 17; 2010/brOnline game developer and publisher Trion Worlds has appointed three new executives to its management team./brChristopher Yates joins Trion as senior vice president of platform and technology; Lisa Bell Cabrera as VP of sales; and Ricardo Sanchez VP of digital./brFormerly CTO for Electronic Arts; Yates most recently spent seven years at Sony; where he led the development and operation of Sony’s Network Platform; the infrastructure that supports PlayStation Network content./brSanchez has worked in the games industry for almost two decades; during which time he helped to launch GameTap.com and was a co founding member of IGN Entertainment; where he oversaw operations for IGN.com; Vault Network; GameSpy.com; Rotten Tomatoes and GameStats.com./brPrior to joining Trion; Bell Cabrera held the VP of sales position at NCsoft; where she led internal sales teams for MMOs throughout North America and Europe. She has also worked in the same role for Atari./brTrion said that the newcomers “will be essential” in the coming months as the company builds the foundations for three upcoming online games; beginning with Rift: Planes Of Telara; which is scheduled for launch in 2011./br"As we prepare to launch the first of three premium games we looked to expand our executive team with industry experts that will help Trion lead the next era of interactive entertainment;" said Trion CEO Lars Buttler.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Trycera Financial Appoints Two Key Executives
Industry: Financial Services : Credit Card and Related Services
The full text of the press release: Sign inBecome a MarketWatch member todayFront PageNews ViewerCommentaryMarketsInvestingPersonal FinanceCommunityGames/brPRESS RELEASE/brOct. 26; 2010; 3:57 p.m. EDT/brTrycera Financial Appoints Two Key Executives/br/brIRVINE; CA; Oct 26; 2010 (MARKETWIRE via COMTEX)    Trycera Financial; Inc. (TRYF 0.05; 0.00; 0.00%) ; a diversified financial services company; today announced that it has appointed two key members to its executive leadership team./br/brThe two appointments are a newly created Chief Technology Officer (CTO) position headed by Kevin Goldstein and Vice President of Sales headed by Reiner Vanooteghem. Both Messrs Goldstein and Vanooteghem have extensive experience within the prepaid card; alternative credit and program management industries and bring vast knowledge and industry networks into Trycera./br/brRay Smith; the President and CEO of Trycera Financial; stated: "The additions of Kevin and Reiner in their respective roles provides the Company an unparalleled path for technology advances and sustainable growth in card and portfolio aggregation. It is a privilege to have both of them joining the leadership team and their expertise will be important in fueling competitive differentiation and both top line and bottom line contributions."/br/brABOUT TRYCERA FINANCIAL; INC./br/brTrycera Financial; Inc. is a financial services company specializing in the delivery of prepaid card programs; prepaid card program management; alternative credit products and bill payment reporting. The Company also markets a diverse suite of personal financial management solutions and pay as you go services that allow consumers the ability to have recurring and non traditional payment information such as rent; utilities; insurance and wireless phone service payments reported to national credit reporting agencies. For more information; please visit the Company's web site at www.trycera.com.

about person: Kevin Goldstein was previously the Chief Technology Officer of an FCRA compliant credit bureau; overseeing the ongoing development of the company's systems architecture in order to assure fair and accurate data collection and adaptability to consumer and lender needs; while minimizing transaction costs and maximizing data security.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Instapaper Becomes a Start Up
The full text of the press release: Instapaper Becomes a Start Up /br27 September 2010/brThe New York Times/brOn Tuesday Marco Arment; the chief technology officer at the social networking site Tumblr; announced that he would be leaving it to tend to a personal project: Instapaper./brI caught up with Mr. Arment on the phone on Wednesday to find out what was next from his personal project./brFor those readers who don't use Instapaper; it's a very simple service that allows you to save articles from a browser to read later on another computer; mobile phone or iPad./brMr. Arment explained that he originally built the product for himself; as he found it difficult to save interesting articles he wanted to read on his iPhone. He said he was the only Instapaper user for the first three months; but after friends began asking if they could gain access to the service; he decided to offer it publicly./br''The goal with Instapaper was always the space shifting and time shifting of content;'' he said. ''I wrote a blog post about it; and that kind of launched it.'' He said he was ''blown away at the response;'' as the service grew by 40;000 users in first few months./brMr. Arment said that he now has 800;000 registered users and that 200;000 people use it on a regular basis./brWhen I asked him what users can expect from the product in the coming months; he noted that until now Instapaper has been a side project; he has focused about 10 hours a week on maintaining it and adding simple iterative new features./br''Basically the plan is to keep doing what I have been doing with it;'' he said; adding that it's always been a profitable business. ''Now; there are features I want to create and business relationships that I'd love to explore.''/brInstapaper offers a downloadable application for the iPhone and iPad; and although there isn't a plan for an Android or BlackBerry application yet; Mr. Arment said he would like to build a high end HTML 5 Web version that would cover all the Android devices coming into the marketplace./brAs for financing; Mr. Arment said he was going to go it alone for now./br''It's all self funded so far and has been for the first six months of the service;'' he said. ''My only costs are my time; server fees and paying the contractor for some Web work.''/brThe only added cost now; he said; is coming up with the money to pay his own health insurance./brThis is a more complete version of the story than the one that appeared in print.
what happened: Marco Arment; CTO at Tumblr; is leaving for Instapaper.
about person: Marco Arment was previously the Assistant Vice President of Enterprise Architecture and IT Application Services for Fireman’s Fund Insurance Company; an Allianz Company.
about company: Tumblr lets you effortlessly share anything. Post text; photos; quotes; links; music; and videos; from your browser; phone; desktop; email; or wherever you happen to be.

title: Director of Technology
headline: Underground Elephant Announces Addition of Former LeadPoint Engineer; Alex Chang
The full text of the press release: Underground Elephant Announces Addition of Former LeadPoint Engineer; Alex Chang/brFriday; September 10; 2010/br/brSAN DIEGO; CA; September 09; 2010 /24 7PressRelease/ — Underground Elephant (www.undergroundelephant.com); a dynamic performance driven ad agency and network; today is pleased to announce the addition of Alex Chang to the team. Mr. Chang is joining Underground Elephant as Director of Technology./brAlex Chang has been a long time pioneer in the online marketing space having implemented systems generating hundreds of millions of dollars year over year. He brings a decade of experience in both product development and B2B B2C systems development. Mr. Chang built the credit card debt B2C matching engine at LowerMyBills.com prior to its acquisition by Experian Interactive. And most recently; he has served as Director of B2B Engineering at LeadPoint having been a primary driver in the growth of the world’s first and largest onlinelead marketplace for connecting consumers to service providers. /brAlex’s ingenuity has not only changed the face of online marketing but has improved the security of our nation’s armed forces. He has previously worked for the US Army in leading the development of the most advanced building access control system in the United States ever seen post 9/11. This system utilized a combination of biometrics with smart cards and are deployed in Department of Defense installations worldwide. /brWhen asked about joining Underground Elephant; Alex Chang said; “Both witnessing and helping to make measurable wins daily have been a big part of what keeps me excited about the Internet advertising space. And with a company as talented and full of energy as the Underground Elephant; I could not imagine a better match. This is the right time and these are the right people to innovate and promote solid quality lead generation with.” /br “We are very excited about adding a trailblazer like Alex to the team. I am pleased to see our team grow stronger and reach even further each day;” said CEO and Founder Jason Kulpa./brUnderground Elephant (www.undergroundelephant.com) generates high quality leads in the Education and Financial Space. They abide to the highest quality standards and continually strive towards improving the user experience. They generate 100% of our traffic internally through paid and organic search methods. Underground Elephant is quickly establishing itself as an industry leader in online direct marketing — currently ranked as the 11th largest ad agency in San Diego. The organization is determined to create a movement and create win win relationships between advertisers and publishers through a tireless emphasis on integrity and quality.
what happened: Alex Chang is joining Underground Elephant as Director of Technology.
about person: Alex Chang has been a long time pioneer in the online marketing space.
about company: Underground Elephant (www.undergroundelephant.com) generates high quality leads in the Education and Financial Space. They abide to the highest quality standards and continually strive towards improving the user experience.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Veeco Appoints Johannes Segner as CTO for CIGS Solar Equipment Business
The full text of the press release: Veeco Appoints Johannes Segner as CTO for CIGS Solar Equipment Business/brSegner To Be Featured in Upcoming Solar Technical Seminar in Valencia; Spain on September 6/br/brPLAINVIEW; N.Y.; Sep 01; 2010 (BUSINESS WIRE)   /br/brVeeco Instruments Inc. (Nasdaq: VECO) announced today that Johannes Segner; Ph.D.; recently joined the Company as Chief Technology Officer of Veeco's Solar Equipment business. In related news; Veeco will host a Solar Technical Seminar on September 6 at EU PVSEC in Valencia; Spain; and will exhibit its CIGS solar manufacturing equipment from September 6 9 at the tradeshow. Dr. Segner will be a featured speaker at the seminar; presenting "Designing a Best of Breed CIGS Thermal Deposition Factory; Lessons Learned & Future Considerations."/br/brDavid Bruns; Vice President and General Manager of Veeco's CIGS Solar Equipment business; commented; "Dr. Segner has been a visionary in the use of thermal co evaporation for production of CIGS solar modules; and will play an integral role in the strategic direction and development of our equipment and the future growth of the business. I am looking forward to showcasing his expertise at our upcoming seminar in Valencia."/br/brDr. Johannes Segner; Ph.D.; commented; "I am excited to join Veeco at this time to help drive further progress with our CIGS thermal deposition equipment. I am also looking forward to our upcoming technical seminar next week; where industry experts and I will discuss how to achieve the promise of high efficiency; low cost CIGS solar technology."/br/brVeeco's CIGS Technical Seminar will be held Monday; September 6 at the Feria Valencia from 1:00 pm to 4:00 p.m. For a detailed agenda and registration information; please visit http://www.veeco.com/support/show_training_detail.aspx?TrainingID=125/br/brDr. Segner joins Veeco following a 30 year career in which he has distinguished himself as a leading expert in the field of thin film coating technology. He was most recently Chief Operating Officer of Solibro GmbH; a leading manufacturer of CIGS based solar cells that is currently producing world leading 13% efficient CIGS modules. In his new role; Dr. Segner will be responsible for establishing Veeco's technical vision for CIGS solar products; leading the development of technology strategy for product platforms; technology roadmaps; partnerships; and external relationships./br/brAbout Veeco/br/brVeeco Instruments; Inc. designs; manufactures; markets and services enabling solutions for customers in the HB LED; solar; data storage; semiconductor; scientific research and industrial markets. We have leading technology positions in our three businesses: LED & Solar Process Equipment; Data Storage Process Equipment; and Metrology Instruments. Veeco's product development; marketing; engineering and manufacturing facilities are located in New York; New Jersey; California; Colorado; Arizona; Massachusetts and Minnesota. Global sales and service offices are located throughout the U.S.; Europe; Japan and Asia Pacific. Please visit www.veeco.com for further information.
what happened: Veeco appointed Johannes Segner as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Johannes Segner was previously the Chief Operating Officer of Solibro GmbH; a leading manufacturer of CIGS based solar cells that is currently producing world leading 13% efficient CIGS modules.
about company: Veeco Instruments; Inc. designs; manufactures; markets and services enabling solutions for customers in the HB LED; solar; data storage; semiconductor; scientific research and industrial markets.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Viacom names David Kline; CIO at Discovery Communications; as CIO of media conglomerate; MTV
The full text of the press release: Viacom names David Kline; CIO at Discovery Communications; as CIO of media conglomerate; MTV/brNEW YORK (AP)   Viacom Inc. said Wednesday that it named David Kline as senior vice president of technology and chief information officer of the media conglomerate and of MTV Networks; which it owns./brKline; who had been an executive vice president and the chief information officer at Discovery Communications; will start at Viacom Nov. 1. He joined Discovery in 2007 after a stint at Rainbow Media; a unit of Cablevision Systems./brIn afternoon trading; Viacom shares changed hands up 32 cents at $41.70 after setting a year high of $41.83
what happened: Viacom Inc. appointed David Kline as Chief Information Officer
about person: David Kline; who had been an executive vice president and the chief information officer at Discovery Communications.He joined Discovery in 2007 after a stint at Rainbow Media; a unit of Cablevision Systems.
about company: Viacom connects with our diverse audiences everywhere they are. As a leading global entertainment content company; we know what our viewers want and proudly deliver it across the globe through television; motion pictures and a wide range of digital media. Our family of prominent and respected brands includes the multiplatform properties of MTV Networks; BET Networks; Paramount Pictures and Paramount Home Entertainment.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: VMware gets its third CTO
Industry: Software & Internet : Data Analytics; Management and Storage
The full text of the press release: VMware gets its third CTO/brThursday; October 14th; 2010 /brAs most virtualization.info readers and VMware customers know; VMware currently has two CTOs: Stephen Herrod; one of the very first engineering directors that joined the company in its early days (Herrod also is the Senior Vice President of R&D) and Scott Davis; co founder and former President and CTO at Virtual Iron; who was promoted CTO of the Desktop Virtualization business unit at VMware in September 2009./brDuring the summer VMware appointed a third one; Paul Strong; as confirmed by Herrod in a video interview recorded earlier this week at the VMworld Europe 2010 conference in Copenhagen (read virtualization.info live coverage here)./brStrong; appointed as CTO of the EMEA region (can we expect an APAC CTO too?) in August; comes from eBay; where he has been a Distinguished Research Scientist for almost five years./brHe was responsible for research into Enterprise Grid Computing; driving eBay’s long term Enterprise Grid strategy/vision. /brAt the same time; Strong has been involved in the Open Grid Forum activity as Chairman first and then Secretary of the board of directors for almost three years./brStrong’s expertise suggests a VMware future expansion in grid computing: he is an expert in the modeling; architecting; design and management of complex distributed systems./brIt’s also hard to see Strong’s role limited to a European activity over the long term.
what happened: VMware; Inc. appointed Paul Strong as Chief Technology Officer
about person: Paul Strong has been involved in the Open Grid Forum activity as Chairman first and then Secretary of the board of directors for almost three years.
about company: VMware is the global leader in virtualization solutions from the desktop to the data center. Customers of all sizes rely on VMware to reduce capital and operating expenses; ensure business continuity; strengthen security and go green.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: WellPoint Appoints New Executive
Industry: Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech : Healthcare; Pharmaceuticals; & Biotech Other
The full text of the press release: WellPoint Appoints New Executive/brInsideINdianaBusiness.com Report/brIndianapolis based WellPoint Inc. (NYSE: WLP) has named an executive vice president of the newly formed Enterprise Business Services organization. Lori Beer has been with the health insurance provider for more than 12 years; most recently serving as chief information officer. A.J. Lang succeeds Beer./br/brOctober 8; 2010/brNews Release /br/brINDIANAPOLIS; Oct 08; 2010   /brWellPoint; Inc. (NYSE: WLP) today announced the appointment of Lori Beer as executive vice president of the newly formed Enterprise Business Services (EBS) organization. EBS is an integrated team that brings together five core business support functions    Service Operations; Operational Excellence; Information Technology; Information Management; and Sourcing and Supplier Management. /br/br"It is essential that we continually evaluate our administrative structure to ensure we appropriately meet the needs of our customers and members. By creating this new; integrated organization; we will operate more efficiently while providing industry leading business support services;" said Angela F. Braly; chief executive officer for WellPoint. "Our customers expect quality products and services at affordable prices and WellPoint is committed to meeting their needs." /brBeer has more than 20 years of technology and related business experience; including more than 12 years at WellPoint. She has a proven track record of optimizing technology investments and driving cost efficiency within the health care; telecommunications and government industries. Additionally; she was recognized by Profiles inDiversity Journal as one of its "Women Worth Watching In 2010;" and named by Insurance & TechnologyMagazine as one of its "Elite Eight." /brA.J. Lang succeeds Beer as chief information officer. He joined WellPoint in 2008 and brings 25 years of IT experience managing global business initiatives in the health care; banking and credit card industries. He most recently served as senior vice president of Systems Delivery for Information Technology (IT) at WellPoint. /br"Aligning our core capabilities will allow us to simplify our technology and streamline our business processes to deliver the most efficient and effective services possible to our customers;" said Lori Beer. "This new Enterprise Business Services unit will further enhance our ability to deliver on our promise to excel at day to day execution." /brAbout WellPoint; Inc./brWellPoint works to simplify the connection between Health; Care and Value. We help to improve the health of our communities; deliver better care to members; and provide greater value to our customers and shareholders. WellPoint is the nation's largest health benefits company; with more than 33 million members in its affiliated health plans; and a total of more than 69 million individuals served through all subsidiaries. As an independent licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association; WellPoint serves members as the Blue Cross licensee for California; the Blue Cross and Blue Shield licensee for Colorado; Connecticut; Georgia; Indiana; Kentucky; Maine; Missouri (excluding 30 counties in the Kansas City area); Nevada; New Hampshire; New York (as the Blue Cross Blue Shield licensee in 10 New York City metropolitan and surrounding counties and as the Blue Cross or Blue Cross Blue Shield licensee in selected upstate counties only); Ohio; Virginia (excluding the Northern Virginia suburbs of Washington; D.C.); and Wisconsin. In a majority of these service areas; WellPoint does business as Anthem Blue Cross; Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield or Empire Blue Cross Blue Shield (in the New York service areas). WellPoint also serves customers throughout the country as UniCare. Additional information about WellPoint is available at http://www.wellpoint.com/. /brSource: WellPoint Inc.
what happened: WellPoint promoted AJ Lang to Chief Information Officer
about person: AJ Lang was previously the senior vice president of Systems Delivery for Information Technology (IT) at WellPoint.
about company: WellPoint works to simplify the connection between Health; Care and Value. We help to improve the health of our communities; deliver better care to members; and provide greater value to our customers and shareholders.

title: Chief Information Officer
headline: Wencor Appoints Three New Execuitve Officers
The full text of the press release: /br12 Oct 2010/brSPRINGVILLE; UTAH – October 11; 2010  Wencor Group; LLC is pleased to announce three new executive officers. Gregory Beason will be joining the executive team as Chief Executive Officer of the Wencor Group. John Chalaris and Keith Hicks will also join the Wencor Group as CFO and CIO respectively./brMr. Beason has 28 years in the aerospace industry in both aftermarket and OEM sales. He has led a number of businesses at Honeywell and most recently at Danaher. In his role as Group Executive at Pacific Scientific Aerospace; he was responsible for growth strategies of six operating companies to deliver year over year top line growth & operating income. Greg will lead the Wencor Group in growing company sales and expanding offerings for its customers./brMr. Chalaris has held several executive financial positions; both in the private and public sectors; most recently with DeCrane Aerospace; but also including Wesco Aircraft; Landmark Aviation; Comprehension Polymers Holdings and General Electric Aircraft Engines. Over the past 25 years; John has led companies through acquisitions; divestitures and new product development and has also managed companies through relationships with private equity investors; banks and external auditors./brMr. Hicks has managed international teams of technical professionals for over 20 years. Before coming to the Wencor Group; he was the Chief Operating Officer at Global Accessories. He also served as Chief Information Officer at Spillman Technologies and Omniglow Corporation. Keith’s strengths include a solid track record of aligning technical initiatives with business strategies; deploying efficient and scalable business support systems; international data center management; and implementing IT enterprise management systems for rapidly growing businesses./br“The Wencor Group is excited to have Mr. Beason; Mr. Chalaris; and Mr. Hicks join our executive team. They each have exceptional backgrounds in their areas of expertise and bring management talent that will help Wencor and its affiliated companies reach the goals we have set for the upcoming years;” stated Russ Adamson; President of Wencor./brWencor is a worldwide industry leader in the manufacture and delivery of commercial aircraft parts. For over 50 years Wencor has been providing proven parts and reliable service to customers around the globe. From OEM to PMA parts; Wencor is committed to delivering superior value while reducing aircraft maintenance costs. To learn more about Wencor; visit www.wencor.com.
what happened: Wencor Group appointed Keith Hicks as Chief Information Officer
about person: Keith Hicks was previously the Owner/Consultant at IT Consulting Services
about company: Wencor is a worldwide industry leader in the manufacture and delivery of commercial aircraft parts.

title: Chief Technology Officer
headline: Brian Magnotta Joins Ziff Davis Enterprise as Chief Technology Officer
The full text of the press release: Brian Magnotta Joins Ziff Davis Enterprise as Chief Technology Officer/br /br /brFormer Reed Business CTO to Take Technology Behind Company's Digital Portfolio to Next Level/br/brNEW YORK; Sept. 8 /PRNewswire/    Ziff Davis Enterprise; a leader in innovative enterprise IT media and engagement solutions; announced today that it has appointed Brian Magnotta as its new Chief Technology Officer./br/brA seasoned executive with 20+ years of experience; Magnotta has managed and capitalized on information technology for numerous industries; including media; publishing; financial services; professional services; transportation; waste services; healthcare and electronics./br/brAs Chief Technology Officer of Ziff Davis Enterprise; Magnotta will oversee all technology operations with a specific focus on increasing the functionality and integration of the company's entire portfolio of digital products from editorial Web sites to digital event platforms. He will report directly to Ziff Davis Enterprise CFO and General Manager Michael Caruso./br/br"Ziff Davis Enterprise has a long history of leveraging and maximizing innovative technology to deliver outstanding digital products for both our readers and our marketing clients;" said Michael Caruso; Ziff Davis Enterprise CFO and General Manager. "With the addition of Brian to our team we'll be able to bring them to an even more advanced and seamless level;" he continued./br/brPrior to joining the company; Magnotta spent seven years at Reed Business Information as their Chief Technology Officer and as a member of their US executive team. Previous to that he was Vice President of Business Applications for Monster Worldwide and served as an Information Technology consultant for McKinsey & Co.; Coopers & Lybrand and Answerthink./br/brAbout Ziff Davis Enterprise; Inc.:/br/brZiff Davis Enterprise; Inc. is B2B technology's trusted information resource. Millions of technology buyers rely on our brands – including eWEEK; Baseline; CIO Insight; Channel Insider; WebBuyersGuide.com; TechDirect; and the Developer Shed network – for relevant; objective content to identify the right solutions for their organizations. Over 300 technology companies; from industry giants to emerging start ups; rely on our contextual content; marketing; and audience development expertise to compress sales cycles and lower their go to market costs. Ziff Davis Enterprise has proven marketing solutions for branding; engagement; and face to face events. Products include print and online advertising; eNewsletter sponsorships; content syndication; eSeminars; virtual tradeshows; events; and custom media services. Ziff Davis Enterprise has a global database of 5.5 million users representing an unparalleled community of business and technology professionals; developers; and the channel. www.ziffdavisenterprise.com./br/brSOURCE Ziff Davis Enterprise/brBack to top/br/brRELATED LINKS/brhttp://www.ziffdavisenterprise.com
